part 1980   other duties the village clerk shall perform other duties as required by state law and as may from time to time be delegated by the president and board of trustees a 1981 a part 1980   vacancy and deputy clerk a in case the office of village clerk becomes vacant for any reason the president and board of trustees shall appoint a successor as is provided by law b the corporate authorities may by resolution appoint a deputy clerk whose role shall be to assist with the duties of the office of the clerk a deputy clerk shall exercise all of the powers and duties of the village clerk which powers and duties shall be exercised only in the absence of the village clerk  provided that the village clerk may delegate such further powers to a deputy clerk as the village clerk may deem necessary from time to time a deputy clerk shall at all times be subordinate to and subject to the authority of the village clerk with respect to all clerk duties and functions in case of absence or vacancy of the deputy clerk the village clerk may authorize any qualified person to act in his or her absence from village hall by written delegation a part 1980  642018 editors note  adopted  changed the title of   from vacancy and temporary appointments to read as herein set out recall of elected officials   purpose this chapter shall vest the power in the electorate to recall officials elected by them so that the officials may be directly responsible for their behavior in office to the electorate the electorate is entitled to expect the proper discharge of those responsibilities the power of the electorate to recall should serve as an impetus to elected officials to be faithful to this trust it is also intended to serve as an expeditious and effective means for removing from office an elected official who has failed to sustain such trust while no specific charges are required to be lodged formally against an elected official to subject him to recall referendum the individual reasons of each elector for signing a recall petition or voting accordingly shall be deemed sufficient cause for a recall a part 1980   short title this chapter shall be known and may be cited as the village of wheeling recall  a part 1980   authority the ordinance codified in this chapter is adopted by the corporate authorities of the village of wheeling pursuant to the authority granted by of the 1970 constitution of the state of illinois a part 1980   definitions as used in this chapter the following terms have the meanings prescribed in this section a elected official means the village president the village clerk and members of the board of trustees of the village of wheeling irrespective of whether the person holding any such office was elected appointed to fill a vacancy or succeeded by operation of law however in the event the village of wheeling adopts another form of municipal government elected official shall mean all officials holding offices regularly filled by election under such form of government b electoral board means the municipal officers electoral board designated in of the election ilcs 5109 as now composed and the provisions of that section are incorporated here by reference  provided that whenever a recall petition comes before the electoral board in which a member of the electoral board is a subject of the petition that member shall be disqualified to serve on the electoral board and be replaced in the manner provided by of the election purposes of proceedings on such petition the same as provided in the case of nominating petitions of members of the electoral board c senior trustee for the purpose of service on the electoral board under this chapter shall be determined by the drawing of blind lots by those trustees qualifying in tenure to serve on the electoral board and to be administered by the village manager and witnessed by the other members of the electoral board d elector means a person registered to vote under the laws of illinois whose residence from which he or she is registered to vote lies within the corporate boundaries of the village of wheeling a part 1980 n 4252011   recall of elected officials a elected officials shall hold office subject to the right of recall vested by this chapter in the people of the village of wheeling any elected official may be recalled and removed from office by majority vote of the electors at a recall referendum initiated as provided in this chapter b the proposition for recall of an elected official shall be in the following form shall be recalled and name of elected official removed from the office of title of office of the village of wheeling and disqualified from being a candidate for village office for 2 years yesno c if a majority of the electors voting on the proposition for recall of an elected official vote in favor of such recall the elected official shall be removed from office and shall be disqualified from being elected or appointed to any such office of the village of wheeling for two years following such recall vote d the removal from office shall be effective immediately upon the official proclamation of such vote on the recall proposition notwithstanding any contest of the results of such vote which may be brought in the circuit court e if the result of an affirmative vote on a recall proposition is reversed by final order of any court of competent jurisdiction the recalled official shall thereupon be restored to office and all rights to salary pension and similar benefits shall be restored and shall relate back to the date of removal as if such official had not been ousted upon such final order any interim appointment to fill the vacancy created by the recall shall thereupon be terminated however any official actions taken by the village with or by such interim appointee and all official actions done by such interim appointee shall be valid and binding f if the result of a negative vote finding the official should not be recalled on a recall proposition is reversed by a final order of any court of competent jurisdiction the official shall be removed from office as of the date of such final order but the twoyear disqualification for future office shall relate from the date of the recall vote a part 1980   recall proceduresinitiation limitations a a recall referendum shall be initiated by the filing of a notice of intention to recall and a recall petition in the office of the village clerk and shall be dated and time stamped by the village clerk b a notice of intention to recall which names an elected official must be filed by an elector in accordance with the requirements of prior to any circulation of any recall petition against such official recall petitions must be circulated by electors and filed within thirty calendar days after a notice of intention to recall is filed naming the official against whom the petition is directed the thirtyday period may not be extended by the filing of subsequent notices of intention to recall c a notice of intention to recall may name more than one elected official a recall petition may name only one elected official d a recall petition must be signed by electors numbering not less than thirtythree percent of the total number of votes cast for the office of village president at the last preceding election at which a village president was elected by the voters of wheeling however if a recall referendum has been conducted during the term of an elected official and against him any subsequent recall petitions against such official during that term must be signed by electors numbering not less than fifty percent of the total number of votes cast for the office of village president at the last preceding election at which a village president was elected by the voters of wheeling e no notice of intention to recall or recall petition may be filed against any elected official within the first year or during the last six months of the term of office of such official f if the recall petitions filed against an elected official pursuant to a notice of intention to recall are subsequently determined to be invalid no further notices of intention to recall or recall petitions may be filed against such official for six months following the filing of the invalid petitions however this limitation shall not apply if the petition found invalid was signed by a total number of electors being less than sixteen percent of total number of votes cast for office village president at the last election a part 1980   notice sheet shall contain the affidavit of the circulator as provided in subsection c a part 1980   challenges to recall petitions a each petition filed within the thirty day period specified in be time stamped by the village clerk when filed and within five days of the end of such period shall be presented by the clerk to the electoral board b the electoral board shall conduct a hearing on each such petition upon due notice in writing to the elected official named therein at least fortyeight hours in advance of such hearing the hearing shall be no sooner than five days nor later than ten days after the thirtieth day after the filing of the notice of intention to recall c the electoral board shall review the petition to ascertain if it is in apparent conformity with the requirements of this chapter the electoral board on its own motion shall strike any signatures or any petitions not in conformity with this chapter which appear from an examination of the petition any elector may present to the electoral board any objections to the form contents or signatures on a recall petition and may present evidence in support any elector may present evidence in opposition to such objections the electoral board may continue its hearing and may require any objections to or defense of a recall petition to be reduced to writing d the electoral board shall determine the validity and sufficiency of each recall petition within twentyone days after its initial hearing all petitions directed at an elected official shall be treated separately and independently no signatures appearing on different recall petitions shall be cumulated but an electors signature appearing on more than one recall petition shall be valid as to each such petition an elector however may be counted only once as to a single petition e if the electoral board determines that a recall petition is invalid or insufficient it shall so certify such certification shall be a final order and shall be entered upon the records of the village and no recall referendum shall be held unless such determination is reversed by a final order of a court of competent jurisdiction a recall petition which is determined to be valid and sufficient shall be certified by the electoral board to the village clerk such certification shall be a final order and shall be entered on the records of the village   recall referenda a a special recall election shall be held no sooner than seventyeight days nor later than eightyeight days after the filing of the recall petitions with the village clerk b the recall referendum shall be submitted to the electors of the village of wheeling after the electoral board has found the petitions to be in conformity with the requirements of this chapter c the corporate authorities of the village of wheeling shall take such action as may be required by the election laws of the state of illinois to ensure submission of such recall proposition in accordance with this section including without limitations the appropriation of funds for the costs of such submission and for printing of the ballots and other election materials d in the event the election laws of the state of illinois are amended to prohibit special elections as required by this chapter then the state statutes shall govern and the recall election shall be submitted to the electorate at the earliest election permitted by law e the village clerk shall certify the proposition to the proper election officials as may be required by the election laws of the state of illinois f notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this chapter a referendum on a recall proposition shall not be held if the elected official who is the subject of such proposition resigns from office prior to the date of the referendum a part 1980   filling vacancies created by recall whenever a vacancy occurs in an electoral office as a result of an affirmative recall referendum the vacancy shall be filled as set forth by the statutes of the state of illinois a part 1980   disqualification of recalled official no person who has been removed from elected office by a recall referendum or who has resigned from such an office after a recall petition directed to him or her has been filed and determined to be valid and sufficient shall be eligible for election or appointment to any office of the village of wheeling within two years of the officials removal or resignation a part 1980 code of ethics   declaration of ethics policy it is the policy of the village that its employees and elected and appointed officers shall in all cases exercise their judgment and perform their duties for the sole benefit of its citizens therefore all such persons shall avoid accepting or retaining any economic benefits or opportunities which could impair or present an actual threat to the exercise of independent judgment it is the responsibility of all such persons to maintain the highest standards of ethical behavior by acting with steadfast integrity unconditional impartiality and a total devotion to the best interests of the villages citizens furthermore all such persons shall endeavor to avoid even the appearance of impropriety a 2003   definitions unless the contrary is stated or clearly appears from the context when used in this the following words and phrases shall have the meanings indicated 1 business entity means any organization or enterprise operated for profit including but not limited to a proprietorship partnership firm business trust joint venture syndicate corporation or association 2 gift means anything of economic value tangible or intangible regardless of the form without adequate and lawful consideration the term gift shall include any gratuity discount entertainment hospitality loan or forbearance having monetary value 3 immediate family means an individuals spouse dependent children others if the interest herein required to be disclosed is constructively controlled by the person required to file a statement of economic interest pursuant to state statutes 4 income means salary wage advance payment fee honorarium or any other consideration for personal professional or commercial services rent dividends interest capital gains received from the sale of real or personal property stocks or bonds return of capital forgiveness or payment of indebtedness discount in the price of anything of value unless the discount is available to members of the public without regard to official status rebate reimbursement for expenses contribution to an insurance or pension program paid by any person other than an employer income also includes a pro rata share of any income of any business entity or trust in which the individual or spouse owns directly indirectly or beneficially a five percent or greater interest 5 interest in real property means and includes but is not limited to the following legal or equitable title a beneficial interest in any trust including a land trust any assignment of any interest from a beneficiary or any other party of an interest a power to direct conveyance a right to receive rents or proceeds from the property a lien a tax sale certificate an option or any other financial interest real or personal direct or indirect in such property including status as a nominee or an undisclosed principal 6 payment means consideration distribution transfer loan advance deposit gift or other rendering of money property services or anything else of value whether tangible or intangible 7 person means an individual proprietorship firm partnership joint venture syndicate business trust company corporation association committee and any other organization or group of persons acting in concert 8 public official means any person holding an office of the village by election or appointment whether paid or unpaid including members of any board committee or commission thereof a 2003   persons affected all of the provisions of this code except as otherwise indicated shall apply to elected and appointed officials of the village and to all employees of the village a 2003   fair and equal treatment a use of public property no public official shall request or permit the use of villageowned vehicles equipment materials personnel or property including intellectual property for personal convenience or profit or political purposes except when such services are available to the public generally or are provided as village policy for the use of such official in the conduct of official business b obligations to citizens no public official or employee shall grant any special consideration treatment or advantage to any citizen beyond that which is afforded to the public in general a 2003   conflict of interest in contracts no elected or appointed officer or employee of the village whether paid or unpaid shall have any interest directly or indirectly in any contract work or business of the village except as may be permitted under the de minimus exceptions set forth in the following state statutes 50 ilcs 1053 10531 and 10532 and 65 ilcs 5315510 of the illinois municipal 65 ilcs 5315510 entitled interest in contracts and paragraph 1053 of the public officer prohibited activities act 50 ilcs 1053 are hereby specifically incorporated into this code as and for the villages conflict of interest in contracts provisions a 2003   preacquisition of interest no public official or employee shall acquire any interest in or any interest affected by any contract transaction zoning decision or other matter at a time when such public official or employee believes or has reason to believe the interest will be directly or indirectly affected by an official act or action of the public official or employee this provision shall not apply to any interest received or under the laws of intestacy a 2003   appearances for private interests no public official or employee shall appear on behalf of any private person other than himself or herself his or her spouse or minor children before the village board or any commission or committee of the village however a member of the president and board of trustees may appear before village commissions or committees on behalf of his constituents in general in the course of his or her duties as a representative of the electorate or in the performance of public or civic obligations no public official or employee shall receive compensation for such appearances a 2003   nondisclosure of confidential information no public official or employee with respect to any contract transaction zoning decision or other matter which is or may be the subject of an official act or action of the village shall without proper legal authorization disclose confidential information concerning the property government or affairs of the village or use such information to advance the financial or other private interest of the public official or employee or others a 2003   incompatible service no public official or employee shall solicit engage in or accept private employment or render service for private interests when such employment or service is incompatible with the proper discharge of his official acts or actions or would tend to impair his independence of judgment in the performance of his official acts or actions a 2003   solicitation of employment no public official or employee shall solicit or accept income or employment from any person with which he or his board commission committee or department is involved for or on behalf of the village and which he is or may be called upon to take or render an official act or action in his official capacity a 2003   later case interest no public official or employee shall after the termination of service or employment with the village appear before any board commission committee or agency of the village in relation to any case proceeding application transaction or contract in which he personally participated during the period of his service or employment or which was under his active consideration a 2003   common law conflict of interestaction required a potential common law conflict of interest can arise whenever official action could result in a personal advantage or disadvantage to the interested official even in circumstances which are not violative of the state conflict of interest statutes whenever an official has a common law conflict of interest such official shall disqualify himself or herself from voting on the matter shall not take any part whatsoever in the discussion of the matter and shall disclose publicly his or her interest which causes the common law conflict of interest a 2003   state officials and employees ethics act a the regulations of 5 ilcs 430515 and 5 ilcs 4301010  of the state officials and employees ethics act 5 ilcs 43011 et seq hereinafter referred to as the act in this section are hereby adopted by reference and made applicable to the officers and employees of the village to the extent required by 5 ilcs 430705 b the solicitation or acceptance of gifts prohibited to be solicited or accepted under the act by any officer or any employee of the village is hereby prohibited c the offering or making of gifts prohibited to be offered or made to an officer or employee of the village under the act is hereby prohibited d the participation in political activities prohibited under the act by any officer or employee of the village is hereby prohibited e for purposes of this section the terms officer and employee shall be defined as set forth in 5 ilcs 430705c f the penalties for violations of this section shall be the same as those penalties set forth in 5 ilcs 430505 for similar violations of the act g this section does not repeal or otherwise amend or modify any existing ordinances or policies which regulate the conduct of village officers and employees to the extent that any such existing ordinances or policies are less restrictive than this section however the provisions of this section shall prevail in accordance with the provisions of 5 ilcs 430705a h any amendment to the act that becomes effective after the effective date of this section shall be incorporated into this section by reference and shall be applicable to the solicitation acceptance offering and making of gifts and to prohibited political activities however any amendment that makes its provisions optional for adoption by municipalities shall not be incorporated into this section by reference without formal action by the corporate authorities of the village i if the illinois supreme court declares the act unconstitutional in its entirety then this section shall be repealed as of the date that the illinois supreme courts decision becomes final and not subject to any further appeals or rehearings this section shall be deemed repealed without further action by the corporate authorities of the village if the act is found unconstitutional by the illinois supreme court j if the illinois supreme court declares part of the act unconstitutional but upholds the constitutionality of the remainder of the act or does not address the remainder of the act then the remainder of the act as adopted by this section shall remain in full force and effect  however that part of this section relating to the part of the act found unconstitutional shall be deemed repealed without further action by the corporate authorities of the village  2004 a 2003   political activity a no public official or employee shall offer or promise to take any official act or action on behalf of any candidate or political party b no appointive public official or employee shall orally by letter or otherwise by use of official authority or influence solicit or be concerned in soliciting any assessment subscription or contribution to any political party  nor shall he be a party to such solicitation by others c no public official or employee shall promise an appointment to any village position as a reward for any political activity d no public official or employee shall display cause to be displayed or permit the display of campaign materials pamphlets or buttons on village vehicles or on village property e no public employee shall conduct any campaign or political activity while on duty or while wearing a uniform normally identified with the village f no public official or employee shall conduct any campaigning or political activity on village property a 2003   filing of complaintsinvestigation thereof the village clerk is authorized to receive and maintain a log of all complaints made against individuals subject to this alleging a violation of the state gift ban act provisions of this be filed with the state legislative ethics commission pursuant to 3 hereof all complaints against elected or appointed village officials and the village manager alleging a violation of the conflict of interest provisions of this be submitted to the village attorney for investigation all complaints against village employees including department heads alleging a violation of the conflict interest provisions of this be submitted to the village manager a 2003   action by village attorney upon review of the evidence the village attorney shall prepare a written report and recommendation for the board of trustees if the village attorney determines that the complaint is not sustained he or she shall so state in the recommendation portion of his or her written report on the other hand if he or she determines that the complaint is sustained the report shall include recommendations for such administrative or legal action as deemed appropriate the board shall then review the report and recommendations of the village attorney and by majority vote including the president determine what action if any is to be taken in accordance with the provisions of this it is a member of the board of trustees who is accused that member shall not participate in the vote in the event no violation is found the village attorneys log and complaint files shall not be open for public inspection unless requested by the individual who was the subject of the complaint to the extent that it is practical to do so an elected official should use his or her best efforts to notify in writing other elected village officials prior to filing a complaint or charges against any village official a 2003   action by village manager upon review of the evidence the village manager shall prepare a written report containing his or her findings and conclusions if the village manager determines that the complaint is not sustained he or she shall so state in the conclusions portion of his or her written report on the other hand if the village manager determines that the complaint is sustained the report shall include his or her conclusions as to the appropriate disciplinary action to be taken against the employee the village manager shall have the power to discharge suspend without pay or demote any employee against whom the village manager sustains the complaint any such disciplinary action taken by the village manager pursuant hereto shall be in full compliance with the applicable provisions of the personnel policy manual of the village in the event no violation is found the village managers log and complaint files shall not be open for public inspection unless requested by the individual who was the subject of the complaint however the person making the complaint shall be notified in writing by the village manager of his or her decision a this not alter the employment relationship of any employee nor provide any employee with additional rights a 2003   penalties any person subject to the provisions of this violates any of its provisions shall be subject to the following sanctions andor penalties 1 the village board after review of the village attorneys recommendation and conclusions may take the appropriate corrective or disciplinary action against any person who is subject to the terms of this who is found to have violated the provisions thereof 2 in appropriate circumstances the village board may direct that appropriate legal proceedings be commenced for the purpose of removal from office 3 the village board may recommend a judicial proceeding to be brought and if the person is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be guilty of knowingly violating any of the provisions of this furnishing false misleading or incomplete information during the investigation with the intent to mislead upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine of not more than one thousand dollars for any one offense 4 if a court determines that a complaint filed pursuant to malicious or frivolous in nature the court may assess against the complainant reasonable attorneys fees and other litigation costs reasonably incurred by the prevailing party a 2003   applicability of other laws nothing in this be deemed to in any way restrict the application of any state local or common law provision with respect to conflict of interest malfeasance misfeasance or nonfeasance in office or employment which would otherwise be applicable to any individual subject to the provisions of this provisions of this be deemed to be additional requirements and shall in no way be construed as a derogation of present statutory penalties and other local remedies for acts prohibited in this a 2003 regulation of village buildings   smoking prohibited prohibitions and exceptions smoking of tobacco and other similar materials is prohibited in any room at which a public hearing is being held by any committee commission board or agency of the village smoking is prohibited in all village of wheeling municipal buildings except where and when permitted by direction of the village manager the no smoking general policy of this section shall be posted conspicuously in all village buildings if the general no smoking policy is posted conspicuously in a village building near the public entrances thereto then smoking in that building shall be permitted only in rooms or areas posted with a sign allowing smoking if the general no smoking policy is not so posted in a village building then smoking therein shall be prohibited in the rooms or areas posted with no smoking signs a part 1980   consumption of food the village manager may adopt regulations specifying areas within each village building in which consumption of food is permitted except in such areas no person shall consume any foods within any village building this section shall not prohibit consumption of coffee soft drinks or other nonalcoholic beverages except as may be specifically prohibited by the manager the manager may adopt policies which make reasonable provision for village employees to take meals and snacks while at their duties as may be desirable in the judgment of the manager the managers regulations shall be posted in a public area of each building in which they are applicable a part 1980   managers regulationsgenerally the manager may adopt other regulations governing the use maintenance and activities of village property which are consistent with the ordinances of the village and necessary or desirable for the protection of village property such regulations issued pursuant to this section and not pursuant to any other provision of the ordinances of the village of wheeling shall be presented to the president and board of trustees at a regular meeting before taking effect and shall not take effect if disapproved by the board of trustees by motion a part 1980   penalties any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter or any regulation adopted pursuant thereto shall be fined not less than ten dollars nor more than one hundred dollars for each such offense a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day a violation occurs or continues a part 1980 employees in general   authorization it is stated that the number of positions in the various village departments is authorized in the fiscal budget which is to be approved by the president and board of trustees on an annual basis prior to may 1 of each year amendments to the authorized number of positions are to be handled as a normal budget amendment and will require legislative approval a part 1980   personnel policy manual a personnel policy manual which outlines the rules and regulations for all employees is to be in force at all times it is to be passed by resolution of the president and board of trustees and amended as necessary the manual is an administrative guide to the employees in regard to their rights and responsibilities a part 1980   ex parte communications a no employee should encourage make or accept any ex parte or other unilateral application or communication that excludes the interests of other parties in a matter under consideration when such application or communication is designed to influence official decision or conduct of the employee himself or other public officials employees or agencies in order to obtain favored treatment or special consideration to advance the personal or private interests of himself or others the purpose of this provision is to guarantee that all interested parties to any matter have equal opportunity to express and represent their interests b any written ex parte communication received by an employee in matters where all interested parties should have equal opportunity for a hearing should be disclosed and made part of the record by the recipient c any oral ex parte communication received under such conditions should be written down in substance by the recipient and also made part of the record d a communication concerning only the status of a pending matter is not regarded as an ex parte communication a 2003 village manager   position created there is created the position of village manager who shall be the chief administrative officer of the village the manager shall appoint a staff to assist him in his responsibilities these positions shall be authorized of the annual budget the staff of the managers office shall be appointed and removed by the manager a part 1980   appointmentremoval a the village manager shall be appointed and removed by the president and board of trustees he shall be appointed without regard to his political beliefs he need not be a resident of the village when appointed but during his tenure of office shall reside within the village unless specifically excused by the board during temporary absence the village manager shall designate a properly qualified person to act as village manager pro tem to perform the duties of the office during extended absence of the village manager or when the position has been vacated the board shall designate an acting village manager b in the event of a national state or local emergency requiring the immediate actions of the village manager or the village manager pro tem and the village manager or the village manager pro tem is incapacitated or otherwise unable to take such necessary actions then the following persons shall during a time of emergency assume the duties and powers of the village manager as set forth in this chapter pursuant to the following order of succession 1 the village manager shall retain his or her powers during a civil emergency as that term is defined by this code unless he or she is incapacitated or otherwise unavailable 2 if the village manager is incapacitated or otherwise unavailable to act then an acting village manager shall be appointed pursuant to subsection a of this section 3 if the village manager andor board of trustees is unable to appoint an acting village manager pursuant to subsection a of this section then the president if capable and available shall appoint a qualified person to act as acting village manager the residency requirement for the position of village manager set forth in subsection a of this section shall be suspended during times of emergency if any person becomes capable or available after being incapacitated or unavailable that person shall immediately assume or resume the duties and powers of the village manager and replace any persons acting as village manager that may have succeeded them pursuant to the order of succession set forth in this subsection  2006 a part 1980   tenure of office the village manager shall serve at the discretion of the corporate authorities a part 1980   bond and oath the village manager shall furnish a surety bond in such amount and form as is approved by the board the bond to be conditioned on the faithful performance of his duties the premium of the bond shall be paid by the village before entering upon the duties of his office the village manager shall take and subscribe the oath prescribed by the statutes of the state of illinois and file an affidavit and disclosure statement as prescribed by the village ordinance a part 1980   compensation the village manager shall receive compensation in the amount and manner as the board shall determine a part 1980   powers and duties the village manager shall be the chief administrative officer of the village and shall be responsible for the management and operation of all the affairs and departments of the village as such administrative officer he shall have the management and control of all matters and things pertaining to the operation and maintenance of the properties of the village and of all the departments of the village specifically but not in limitation of the above the village manager shall 1 hire suspend or remove employees as set forth in the personnel policy manual  2 cause to be purchased all materials supplies and equipment for which funds have been provided in the budget  3 routinely attend all official meetings of the board of trustees and such other meetings as the board may require and attend and participate in all committee meetings meetings of task forces workshops and meetings of the boards and commissions the village manager shall have the privilege of taking part in discussion of all matters coming before the board and shall make recommendation on all matters under his purview he may be excused from a meeting of the board whenever the board deems it necessary  4 investigate all complaints in regard to administration operation and activities  5 keep the village board currently informed on matters of policy and legislation that relates to board responsibility  6 be responsible for the preparation of the annual budget  7 consolidate combine or reorganize positions divisions or units of departments under his jurisdiction consistent with other ordinances of the village  8 cause to be prepared and present to the corporate authorities financial statements which shall show according to accepted accounting practices the financial state of the village  9 have power to issue on behalf of the board all licenses and permits not otherwise provided by ordinance or statute  10 devote his entire working time to the discharge of official duties  11 not participate in any local political activities  12 perform other duties as may be required of him by the board consistent with the ordinances and statutes of the state of illinois  13 keep himself advised on all public improvements within the village  14 be responsible for the preparation of all agendas for board meetings with the advice of staff  15 have the authority to bind the village to indemnification obligations required under contracts that require payment from the village of under twenty thousand dollars a part 1980 a 242013 village attorneyprosecutor shall be the day of the publication of the notice and the time shall run consecutively thereafter including therein saturdays sundays and legal holidays the newspaper notice required by this section shall include a general description of the articles to be purchased or sold or the work to be performed the location where blank bid forms and specifications may be secured the time by which bids must be submitted the location where the bids must be submitted and the time and place for opening bids b the village may solicit sealed bids from all responsible bidders whom the village manager or bidders a copy of such newspaper notice or such other notice as will acquaint them with the proposed purchase or sale a 1999   format for submission of bids bids shall be submitted in a sealed opaque envelope to the village manager each bid shall be addressed to the village manager and shall bear on the face of the envelope the name of the bidder a statement that it is a sealed bid to be opened on as required herein may be rejected and not considered a proper bid a 1999   bid opening procedures a bids shall be opened by the village manager or hisher designee in public at the time and place specified in the public notice in the presence of a representative of the department recommending the purchase b a tabulation of all bids received shall be made available for public inspection in the office of the village manager within a reasonable period of time after opening of the bids c any bid which is not submitted in the form as required by which is inadvertently opened prior to the official bid opening shall be rejected a 1999   award of contract a the village manager is empowered to award contracts on behalf of the village within the purview of this which are under twenty thousand dollars except as otherwise provided herein the president and board of trustees shall award all other contracts b contracts subject to bidding requirements shall be awarded to the lowest responsible bidder as determined at the sole discretion of the corporate authorities in determining the lowest possible bidder the corporate authorities shall consider the following as well as other criteria i the ability capacity and skill of the bidder to perform the contract or provide the service required  ii the capacity of the bidder to perform the contract or provide the service promptly or within the time specified without delay or interference  iii the character integrity reputation judgment experience and efficiency of the bidder including but not limited to past performance record  default under previous contracts whether or not such contracts were with the village  competency  and failure to pay or satisfactorily settle all bills due for labor and material on former contracts  iv the quality of performance of previous contracts or services  v the previous and existing compliance by the bidder with laws and ordinances relating to the contract or service  vi the sufficiency of the financial resources and financial ability of the bidder to perform the contract or service  vii the quality availability and adaptability of the supplies machinery plant or other equipment or contractual services to the particular use required  viii the ability of the bidder to provide future maintenance and service for the use of the subject of the contract including guarantees  ix whether the bidder is entitled to local preference as set forth in this c when the award is not recommended to be given to the lowest bidder a statement of the reasons for such award recommendation shall be prepared d nothing set forth herein shall prohibit the village from negotiating a lower price than the lowest responsible bidder a 1999 a 7162012   rejection of bids the corporate authorities may reject any and all bids received may waive any procedural informality in the bidding process if determined to be in the best interest of the village or if no bids are received may a abandon the project  b readvertise for new bids  or c provide for the contract to be negotiated in the open market a 1999   advance disclosures any disclosure of information contained in any submitted bid documents in advance of the opening of bids made or permitted by a member of the corporate authorities or a village officer or employee or representative thereof shall operate to void the bid in its entirety as to all bidders a 1999   documents required for purchase or contract the following requirements shall be met in the manners indicated below a bid security i public works or construction amount as determined by the village manager the security will be held to ensure good faith on the part of the bidder and to be applied as liquidated damages should the successful bidder fail to requirements for purchases or contracts of twenty thousand dollars or more to read as herein set out   change orders change orders shall be executed in the following manner a the village manager is hereby empowered to execute the following change orders i change orders that do not alter the scope cost or quality of the project  and ii change orders that cumulatively result in less than a ten thousand dollar reduction in cost and do not alter the time of completion of the project by a period of thirty days or more b the village manager is hereby empowered to execute the following change orders without prior approval by the corporate authorities provided however heshe shall report such change orders to the corporate authorities i change orders which result from emergency situations in the discretion of the village manager with emergency situations being defined as a any clear and present danger or hazard to health safety or welfare  or b condition which would require the cessation of work on the project if not immediately executed ii change orders which result in an additional project cost if the accrued costs of all change orders to date are below ten thousand dollars and provided that the change order being considered does not necessitate an increase or decrease in the time to complete a project by a total of thirty days or more iii all change orders not included in subsection a or b of this section shall be effective only after prior approval of the corporate authorities if such approval is given the village manager is hereby authorized to execute such change orders iv all change orders necessitating an increase or decrease in the cost of a contract by a total of ten thousand dollars or more or the time of completion by a total of thirty days or more shall be effective only after prior approval of the corporate authorities and a finding that the circumstances said to necessitate the change in performance were not reasonably foreseeable at the time the contract was made  or the change is germane to the original contract as signed  or the change is in the best interests of the village and authorized by law a 1999 c 11232015   exclusions from this part 1980 economic development revenue bonds   short title this chapter may be referred to as the village of wheeling economic development revenue bond enabling  a part 1983 a part 1980   definitions the following words and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed below a bond ordinance means the ordinance authorizing a specific issue of bonds adopted by the president and board of trustees of the village in accordance with the policies set forth in this chapter and such other supplementary ordinances resolutions and other proceedings as they deem necessary describing the public purpose to be served b economic development project means any capital project including any land interest in land building structure facility system fixture improvement addition appurtenance machinery or equipment or any combination thereof and all real and personal property deemed necessary in connection therewith  provided that the existence of such economic development project will 1 create or retain employment opportunities in or near the village  or 2 increase the tax base of the village  or 3 provide for the health and welfare of the citizens of the village and be a project of good standing which will benefit the village of wheeling c person means any individual partnership copartnership firm company corporation including public utilities association joint stock company trust estate political subdivision state agency or any other legal entity or its legal representative agent or assigns d project means any economic development project located within the village or within ten miles of the corporate boundaries but not within another municipality e project costs means and includes the sum total of all reasonable or necessary costs incidental to the acquisition construction reconstruction repair alteration improvement and extension of a project including without limitation the cost of studies and surveys plans specifications architectural and engineering services legal marketing or other special services financing acquisition demolition construction equipment and services financing acquisition demolition construction equipment and site development of new and rehabilitated buildings rehabilitation reconstruction repair or remodeling of existing buildings and all other necessary or incidental expenses whether directly or indirectly related to the project including an initial bond and interest reserve together with interest on bonds issued to finance a project to a date six months subsequent to the estimated date of completion and any costs or expenses which may be included under the provisions of b of the internal revenue as amended the term project costs shall also include all village costs including but not limited to printing publication fiscal financial legal review public hearing and the costs of preparation of all ordinances resolutions agreements and other legal and financial documents that are necessary to authorize and deliver the economic development bonds f village means the village of wheeling cook and lake counties illinois a part 1983 a part 1980   declaration of purpose it is hereby determined and declared that the purpose of this chapter is to provide a means of financing the costs of projects which will relieve conditions of unemployment increase the tax base of the village provide for the public safety health and welfare of the citizens of the village andor to encourage the increase of industry or commerce within or near the village these are declared to be public purposes and functions pertaining to the government and offices of the village a part 1983 a part 1980   additional powers the village of wheeling cook and lake counties illinois acting by and president and board of trustees shall have the power and authority under this chapter 1 to construct acquire by gift purchase or lease reconstruct improve better or extend or to finance the construction acquisition reconstruction improvements betterment extension of any economic development project within or partially without the village but in no event further than ten miles from the territorial boundaries of the village and if deemed necessary to acquire by gift purchase lease lands or rights in land in connection with any economic development project  2 to issue revenue bonds to defray in whole or in part the project costs of any economic development project and to designate an appropriate name for such bonds which bonds shall be issued pursuant to a bond ordinance authorizing the same  3 to enter into leases or other agreements including without limitation loan agreements with any person in order to secure the villages revenue bonds  provided however that any such lease or other agreement must provide that such person shall pay to for or on behalf of the village an amount sufficient to pay principal interest redemption premiums and all other costs in connection with the villages revenue bonds so that such bonds will never constitute an indebtedness of the village or the loan of its credit within the meaning of any constitutional or statutory provision  4 to pledge to the punctual payment of bonds authorized under this chapter the interest thereon and the redemption premiums if any the revenue and receipts to be received pursuant to such leases or other agreements  5 to mortgage such project in favor of the holder or holders of bonds issued therefor  6 to sell and convey such project including without limitation the sale and conveyance thereof subject to a mortgage if any as provided in this chapter for such price and at such time whether prior or subsequent to the payment in full of bonds authorized under this chapter as the president and board of trustees of the village may determine however no sale or conveyance of such project shall ever be made in such manner as to impair the rights or interests of the holder or holders of any bond issued hereunder  7 to issue its bonds to refund in whole or in part bonds theretofore issued by the village under authority of this chapter a part 1983 a part 1980   exercise of powersbond ordinance a the exercise of for issuance a prior to the issuance of any economic development bonds the president and board of trustees will require the following statements 1 a statement from the village attorney that he obligations 3 a statement from the director of community development that the industry is in compliance with the villages comprehensive plan and that the industry would be an asset to the village 4 a statement from the director of finance that suitable arrangements have been made for the payment of all fees 5 a statement from the village manager that he has reviewed all documents and recommends to the president and board of trustees that they authorize the issuance of the industrial revenue bonds b the president and board of trustees reserve the right to have the applicant appear before them to explain the proposed development and to answer any questions c upon completion of all steps the president and the board of trustees shall consider approval of industrial revenue bond issue the any part of the village of wheeling may be situated such bond ordinance as so filed shall constitute the authority for such county clerks in and for each of the years for which taxes are levied in the provide containment and mitigation when possible  d provide specialized rescue services for entrapment high angle rescue and underwater rescuerecovery  e support private entities in providing 1980 emergency and disaster management footnotes  2  editors note of approved on dec 22 200 replaced ch 232 emergency services and disaster agency   in its entirety to read as herein set out former ch 232 derived from passed 1980   definitions a disaster defined the term disaster shall mean an occurrence or threat of widespread or severe damage injury or loss of life or property resulting from any natural or technological cause including but not limited to fire flood earthquake wind storm tornado hazardous materials spillrelease or other water contamination requiring emergency action to avert danger or damage epidemic air contamination blight extended periods of severe and inclement weather drought infestation riot civil unrest public health emergencies or acts of domestic terrorism b emergency management coordinator emc defined the term emergency management coordinator shall mean a specific member of the village of wheelings administrative staff assigned responsibility for coordinating the village of wheelings emergency management programs during a disaster the emergency management coordinator shall serve as the village of wheelings incident commander in accordance with the national incident management system nims the abbreviation emc shall be used to refer to the emergency management coordinator c emergency operations center eoc defined the term emergency operations center shall refer to a specific physical location at which the coordination of information and resources to support the management of large scale emergency situations or disasters that affect the village of wheeling occurs within the emergency operations center key personnel from all the villages operating departments are represented as well as members of the village board and outside public and private organizations who have a direct role in the emergency the abbreviation eoc shall be used to refer to the emergency operations center d emergency operations plan eop defined the term emergency operations plan shall refer to a written plan describing the organization mission and functions within the village of wheeling for responding to and recovering from disasters the abbreviation eop shall be used to refer to the emergency operations plan e emergency services defined the term emergency services shall mean those resources managed owned deployed andor coordinated by the village of wheeling to prevent minimize repair and alleviate injury and damage resulting from any disasters caused by natural or manmade causes these functions shall include but are not limited to fire suppression services emergency medical services health services hazardous materials containmentmitigation services law enforcement services public work services technical rescue services utility restoration services as well as other functions related to the protection of residents and the overall protection of life or property f illinois emergency management agency iema defined the term illinois emergency management agency shall apply to the agency created by the executive branch of the state of illinois responsible for the coordination of the overall emergency management program for the state of illinois the abbreviation iema shall be used to refer to the illinois emergency management agency g incident commander ic defined the term incident commander shall refer to the individual responsible for all incident activities including the development of strategies and tactics as well as the ordering of and releasing of resources during an emergency situation the incident commander has the overall authority and responsibility for conducting incident operations the abbreviation ic shall be used to refer to the incident commander h incident action plan iap defined the term incident action plan refers to an oral or written plan containing general objectives that reflect the overall strategy for managing an emergency incident it may include the identification of operational resources and assignment of these resources to particular aspects of the emergency incident the abbreviation iap shall be used to refer to the incident action plan i national incident management system nims defined the term national incident management system shall refer to a system mandated by the federal government that provides a consistent nationwide approach for federal state local and tribal governments  private sector  and nongovernmental organizations to work effectively and efficiently together to prepare for respond to and recover from domestic incidents regardless of cause size or complexity the national incident management system encompasses incident command multiagency coordination training identification and management of resources as well as the collection tracking and reporting of incident information the abbreviation nims shall be used to refer to the national incident management system j supervisory employee defined the term supervisory employee as used in this refer to those employees with direct managerial responsibilities during an emergency or disaster situation within the village of wheeling this shall be limited to village manager assistant village manager fire chief deputy fire chief battalion fire chief fire lieutenant police chief deputy police chief police commander police sergeant public works director assistant public works director public works superintendent public works supervisor director of community development deputy director of community development deputy code official finance director and assistant finance director these individuals are authorized to request the activation of the emergency operations center eoc as well as serving as incident commander ic when necessary k unified incident command uic defined the term unified incident command uic refers to the incident command system utilized where there is more than one village of wheeling operating department or outside organization private or governmental with incident jurisdiction or when an incident crosses political jurisdictions all entities work together designated members department andor organization to establish a common set of objectives and strategies as well as a single incident action plan the abbreviation uic shall be used to refer to the use of unified incident command a 12222008   national incident management system nims the national incident management system nims shall be implemented during all local emergency incidents disasters or emergencyrelated training exercises during emergency incidents or disasters an incident commander shall be designated and shall have the authority to implement an incident action plan iap that is formulated and directed towards the protection of life and property without prior consultation or approval by any village of wheeling department head the village manager andor any member of the village board the incident commander ic will be selected based upon the type of emergency incident complexity of the emergency incident the overall incident management objectives as well as but not limited to the training educational background and overall related experience of the individual in the event of a large scale emergency incident or disaster which requires the involvement of two or more village of wheeling operating departments andor the involvement of outside organizations private or governmental a unified incident command system shall be implemented a 12222008   emergency management coordinator emc a an emergency management coordinator emc will be of fire and police commissioners   creation and terms of office there is hereby created a board of fire and police commissioners which shall consist of five members appointed by the village president with the approval of the board of trustees the term of office for such members shall be for three years and until his successor is appointed and shall qualify the village president shall have the power to remove any of the commissioners for cause after a public hearing before the board of trustees and such removal shall be subject to confirmation by a majority of the members of the corporate authorities of the village a part 1983 a 6292009   qualifications a the members of the board of fire and police commissioners shall be residents of the village upon appointment they shall be considered officers of the village and shall file an oath with the village clerk b no person holding an office in the village shall be a member of the board of fire and police commissioners the acceptance of any such office by a member of the board shall be deemed a resignation of his office as a commissioner no person shall be appointed a commissioner who is related either by blood or marriage up to the degree of first cousins to any member of the corporate authorities c no more than two commissioners shall belong to the same political party existing in the village at the time of such appointments and as defined in of the illinois election only one or no political party exists in the village at the time of such appointments the state or national political party affiliations shall be considered in making such appointments party affiliation shall be set forth in an affidavit of the person appointed as a commissioner a part 1983 a 4252011   duties of the board the board of needs and concerns of senior citizens residing within and near the village including housing employment education income recreation physical and mental health nutrition transportation legal aid retirement roles and activities and to make findings and recommendations to the president and board of trustees in connection therewith  b to receive evaluate and analyze complaints of senior citizens residing within the village and to make findings and recommendations to the village manager and the president and board of trustees in connection therewith  c to review evaluate and analyze programs services and facilities of the village which are directed at or which significantly affect senior citizens residing within the village and to make findings and recommendations to the village manager and board of trustees  e to review evaluate and analyze programs services and facilities which are operated administered or funded by other governmental agencies and which are intended to serve or serve and benefit senior citizens in the village including publicity and education  i to serve generally as a representative and advocate for the senior citizens residing within the village  and j to conduct public hearings engage in research and studies and otherwise obtain information and develop knowledge in connection with the foregoing responsibilities the commission shall not issue any an intergovernmental agreement with the city of des plaines approved by a duly adopted resolution of the village board on   4172017   funding if authorized by 50 ilcs 750153 the village of wheeling shall impose a surcharge on monthly billed subscribers of telecommunication carriers at a rate per network connection in order to implement and maintain a 911 emergency telephone system a surcharge is hereby imposed on monthly billed subscribers of telecommunications carriers residing within the corporate limits of the village at a rate of zero dollars per month per network connection said surcharge shall be collected by the telecommunications carriers for purposes of computing the surcharge imposed the network connections to which the surcharge shall apply shall be those inservice network connections other than those network connections assigned to the city where the subscriber service address for each such network connections is located within the corporate limits of the city each telecommunication carrier is hereby authorized and instructed to deduct and retain three percent of the gross amount of the surcharge collected prior to remittance for reimbursement of the expense of accounting and collecting said surcharge all monies collected from the 911 surcharge shall be deposited into an interest bearing bank account known as the emergency telephone system fund administered by the director of finance  however said monies collected shall not include the above reimbursement the account shall be administered in accordance with the bylaws of the joint emergency
