due on or before the first day of the second month after the taxes have been collected eg the return for january shall be due on or before the first day of march  the return for february shall be due on or before the first day of april  etc 2 if for any reason any tax due pursuant to this not paid when due penalties and interest thereon shall be imposed in accordance with the provisions of this 3 owners filing tax returns pursuant to this subsection shall at the time of filing such return pay to the village the amount of the tax imposed by this less a commission of one percent of the amount of the tax which is allowed to reimburse the owners for the expenses incurred in keeping records billing preparing and filing returns remitting the tax and supplying data to the village upon request no commission may be claimed by an owner for taxes not timely remitted to the village  part 2005 h 3212011   transmittal of excess tax collections if any person collects an amount upon a sale not subject to the tax imposed but which amount is purported to be the collection of such tax or if a person collects an amount upon a sale greater than the amount of the tax so imposed herein and does not for any reason return the same to the purchaser who paid the same before filing the return for the period in which such occurred such person shall account for and pay over those amounts to the village along with the tax properly collected  part 2005   collection whenever any person shall fail to pay the tax imposed by this the village attorney or village prosecutor shall upon request of the village manager bring or cause to be brought an action to enforce the payment of such tax on behalf of the village in any court of competent jurisdiction  part 2005   suspension of licenses if the village manager after a hearing held by him or for him by his designee shall find that any owner has willfully avoided the payment of any tax imposed by this heshe may suspend or revoke all village licenses held by such tax evader the owner shall have an opportunity to be heard at such hearing to be held not less than ten days after being mailed notice of the time when and the place where the hearing is to be held addressed to him at his last known place of business any suspension or revocation of any licenses shall not release or discharge the owner from his civil liability for the payment of the tax nor from prosecution for such offense  part 2005   penalties 1 any person found guilty of violating disobeying omitting neglecting or refusing to comply with or unlawfully resisting or opposing the enforcement of any of the provisions of this except when otherwise specifically provided upon conviction thereof shall be punished by a fine of not less than two hundred dollars nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars for the first offense and not less than five hundred dollars nor more than seven hundred fifty dollars for the second and each subsequent offense in any one hundred eighty day period 2 each day upon which a person shall continue any violation of this or permit any such violation to exist after notification thereof shall constitute a separate and distinct offense 3 if any tax imposed by this is not paid when due a late payment interest penalty equal to two percent of the unpaid tax shall be added to each month that such tax remains unpaid 4 any owner subjected to of such inspection report form to the licensee or operator such inspection report shall indicate specific violations found and shall establish a specific and reasonable period of time for compliance f the completed inspection report form is a public document that shall be made available for public disclosure to any person who requests it according to law  972010  d 1232018   correction of violations a the completed inspection report form shall specify the violations found and the period of the time for the correction of the violations the inspector can reinspect unlimited inspections for any deficiencies at their discretion b the inspection report shall state that failure to comply with any notice for corrections may result in suspension of the food service or retail food operations c whenever a food service establishment or retail food store is required under the provisions of this section to cease operations it shall not resume operations until it is shown on reinspection that the conditions responsible for the order to cease operations no longer exists opportunity for reinspection shall be offered as soon as possible but not later than fortyeight hours after a request for reinspection has been made to the health officer or their designee d in the case of a temporary food service establishment all violations shall be corrected within the time frame noted by the health officer or his designee if violations are not corrected the establishment shall immediately cease food service operations until authorized to resume by the health officer or their designee  972010  d 1232018   emergency suspension of health permit the health officer or their designee may temporarily suspend a health permit without a hearing if an imminent or substantial health hazard to the public exists including but not limited to fire flood lack of refrigeration interruption of electrical gas or water supply apparent foodborne illness outbreak gross insanitary occurrence severe infestation of rodents insects or vermin or sewage backup into the establishment or any other condition or circumstance that may endanger public health in these circumstances the establishment shall immediately cease food service operations the public health officer shall issue a notice to the licensee or operator citing the conditions specifying the time period within which action shall be taken to correct the conditions operation shall not resume until authorized by the health officer or their designee  972010  d 1232018   reinstatement of suspended health permit any person whose health permit has been suspended due to the existence of an imminent health hazard may request a reinspection for the purpose of reinstatement of the health permit within fortyeight hours following receipt of a request the health officer or their designee shall make a reinspection if the reinspection reveals acceptable sanitary conditions and compliance with the requirements of this the health permit shall be reinstated  972010  d 1232018   suspension of health permit a the village may suspend a health permit for the following reasons after providing notice and an opportunity for a hearing the standards of the national sanitation foundation as to construction installation and performance b all food service establishments shall provide dry storage facilities which are separate and in 972010   examination and condemnation of food a samples of food and other substances may be examined or sampled by the health officer or their designee as often as may be necessary to determine freedom from adulteration and misbranding and determine bacteriological contact the health officer or their designee may request the condemnation of or request the removal destruction or denaturing of any food which is unwholesome adulterated or misbranded the health officer or their designee shall upon written notice to the owner or person in charge place a tag or hold order on any food they determine or has probable cause to believe to be unwholesome the health officer or their designee shall permit storage of food under conditions specified in the hold order unless storage is not possible without risk to the public health in which case immediate destruction shall be ordered and accomplished it shall be unlawful for any person to remove or alter a hold order notice or tag placed on food by the health officer or their designee and neither such food nor the containers thereof shall be relabeled or repacked reprocessed altered disposed of or destroyed without permission of the health officer or their designee except on order by a court of competent jurisdiction b the health officer or their designee may vacate the hold order or may by written order direct the owner or person in charge of the food which was placed under the hold order to denature or destroy such food or to bring it into compliance with provisions of this   provided that such order shall be stayed if a hearing is requested within fortyeight hours if food is denatured or destroyed such action shall be taken under the supervision of the health officer or their designee  972010  d 1232018   disease a when the public health officer or their designee has reasonable cause to suspect possibility of disease transmission from any food establishment or employee the public health officer shall make such investigation including the morbidity history of suspected employees and take appropriate action b the public health officer or designee may require any or all of the following measures 1 the immediate closure of the food establishment until in the opinion of the public health officer no further danger of disease outbreak exists upon such closure the establishment may reopen only upon authorization from the public health officer 2 the immediate exclusion of the employee from all food establishments 3 restriction of the employees services to some area of the establishment where there would be no danger of transmitting disease 4 adequate medical and laboratory examinations of the employee and if deemed necessary other employees d 1232018   penalties any person firm or deemed existing on each day on which a violation continues or occurs in addition thereto such persons may be enjoined from continuing such violations  972010   food service and food processing establishment grease trapinterceptor requirements the purpose of this section is to establish rules and regulations for the management of fats oils and greases fog discharged to the village sanitary sewers by food service and food processing establishments a definitions the definitions contained in this be observed and applied 1 fog means fats oils greases starches proteins and certain other materials from animal or vegetable origins fog may originate from discharges from scullery sinks pot and pan sinks food processing equipment and floor drains located in a food processing area of a food manufacturer retail food store or food service establishment 2 food processing establishment means a commercial facility in which food is manufactured or packaged for human or domestic animal consumption the term does not include a food service establishment or retail food store 3 grease trapinterceptor shall mean a constructed device whether installed internally or externally and its surfaces and working parts with the function of removing fog from wastewaters before such waters are discharged to village sanitary sewer system 4 hauler means a waste disposal business that hauls and disposes of pumped materials and waste from a grease trapinterceptor 5 high volume establishment means a food establishment retail food store or bakery that has deep fat fryers woks griddles and those establishments that bake cook prepare or wash greaseladen foods greaseladen equipment or utensils 6 low volume establishment means a food establishment or retail food store which does not have fryers or woks and those establishments that do not cook prepare or wash large amounts of greaseladen foods or greaseladen equipment 7 manifest means a log or document record of the haulers name and address  and the volume date of removal and disposal destination of pumped materials or waste from a grease trapinterceptor 415 ilcs 2230d e 8 village means the village of wheeling or its representatives from public works and community development departments as well as the public health and engineering divisions 9 twentyfive percent rule 25% rule means all grease trapsinterceptors shall be cleaned based on the 25% rule for example if the total depth td of a grease trapinterceptor is forty inches the maximum allowable depth d of floatable and settled fog equals forty inches multiplied by 025 or d   td x 025   10 inches therefore the maximum allowable depth of floatable and settled fog in the grease trapinterceptor should not exceed ten inches b required installation and use of grease trapinterceptors 1 each person or operating facility within the village other than a private residence which is or will be used for the manufacture processing or preparation of food or food products must install and use at its own expense an appropriately sized grease trapinterceptor 2 external grease interceptors are required for high volume establishments a permit is required community development department and the metropolitan water reclamation district of greater chicago 3 all new or altered restaurants that require an external grease trapinterceptor shall install a minimum of a one thousand gallon unit as per the villages engineering grease basin standard 4 mechanical dishwashers will not be allowed to connect to any grease trap interceptor 5 interior grease traps are required for low volume establishments these restaurants do not have deep fat fryers woks or griddles and limit their menu to nonfried foods sandwiches soups and other fresh foods grease traps are required for retail food stores that have meat cutting rooms fish and deli areas interior grease traps must be cleaned and maintained on a weekly basis to prevent backups and odors c required cleaning maintenance and inspection of grease trapinterceptors 1 operation of plumbing equipment the illinois state plumbing all plumbing equipment required by this be operated in the manner intended by the manufacturer and as required by the metropolitan water reclamation district of greater chicago operating permit no alteration or modifications to plumbing fixtures equipment and appurtenances which negate specified safety features shall be allowed all plumbing systems shall be maintained in a functional safe and sanitary condition the owner of the facility shall be responsible for maintenance of the sanitary plumbing system 2 each person who owns or operates a grease trapinterceptor shall have it maintained by having the accumulated fog removed by a licensed hauler the collected material shall be delivered to a facility authorized to use treat or dispose of such material 3 high volume establishments shall have the grease trapinterceptor cleaned of accumulated fog completed on a biannual basis unless the village determines that less or more frequent maintenance schedule is required to minimize the discharge of fog into the village sanitary sewer system 4 low volume establishments shall have the grease trapinterceptor cleaned of accumulated fog completed on a biannual basis unless the village determines that less or more frequent maintenance schedule is required to minimize the discharge of fog into the village sanitary sewer system 5 the structural integrity of the grease trapinterceptor shall be maintained any decaying structure as determined by the village must either be replaced or be repaired repairs or replacement shall be the sole responsibility of the owner d prohibition of discharge of fog 1 no person shall discharge a concentration of fog into the village sanitary sewers from a facility required to install use and maintain a grease trapinterceptor 2 no person shall reintroduce or deposit into the sanitary sewer system fog which have been removed from the sewer system by grease trapsinterceptors e prohibitions on introduction of enzymes and emulsifiers 1 no person shall introduce nor allow the introduction of physical chemical or biological agents into grease trapinterceptors for the purpose of suspending dissolving emulsifying or rendering soluble any fog removed from wastewater by such grease trapinterceptors and reintroducing them into the village sanitary sewer system f record keeping requirements for grease trapinterceptors 1 the owner or operator of the grease trapinterceptor shall receive a manifest form from the licensed hauler after the grease trapinterceptor is cleaned this manifest shall be retained for a minimum of two years by the owner or operator and the copies be stored on site 2 a copy of the most recent manifest must be sent to the village health division biannually onor before july 31st and december 31st g inspections any of the following three methods listed below may be used to determine if any grease trapinterceptor is functioning properly 1 the village may make without notice to the owner of the facility periodic inspections of the grease trapinterceptor to verify current operating conditions the inspectors may use the 25% rule to check the condition of the grease trapinterceptor 2 visual inspection of the grease trapinterceptor will be conducted to verify structural integrity and functionality 3 inspections of manholes downstream of grease trapinterceptors will be conducted by village inspectors to check for accumulations of greases from upstream grease trapinterceptors h failure to maintain grease trapinterceptors 1 if the operating condition of the grease trapinterceptor is found to be in noncompliance the owner shall be required to take immediate action to correct such deficiencies with the grease trapinterceptor upon receipt of the inspection reportnotice of violation 2 if the owner does not correct the deficiencies noted on the notice of violation in the time frame established the village may cause the grease trapinterceptor and private sewer lines to be properly cleaned and maintained either parties hired by the village or by village staff 3 the owner of the grease trapinterceptor will be held liable for all costs incurred by the lack of maintenance including labor materials administrative costs whether by outside contractors or by village staff 4 the business license or annual businessrelated license may be suspended revoked or not renewed if the owner fails to reimburse the village for incurred expenses 5 administrative citations will be issued to those establishments that fail to maintain their grease trapinterceptors  972010 miscellaneous health regulations footnotes  4  note municipal authorities may act or separate offense g 1232018 medical waste purpose the purpose of this to protect the environment and the public from infection and injury from improperly stored and disposed of infectious medical waste a part 1991   definitions the terms shall have the following meanings when used in this 1 biologicals means preparations made from living organisms and their products including vaccines cultures etc intended for use in diagnosing immunizing or treating humans or animals or in research pertaining thereto 2 blood products means any product derived from human blood including but not limited to blood plasma platelets red or white blood corpuscles and other derived products such as interferon etc 3 body fluids means liquid emanating or derived from humans or animals limited to blood cerebrospinal synovial pleural peritoneal and pericardial fluids and semen and vaginal secretions 4 communicable disease means an infectious agent or its toxic products which can be transmitted directly or indirectly to a well person from an infected person animal or arthropod or agency of an intermediate host vector or the inanimate environment 5 contaminated means the presence of blood blood products body fluids excretia secretions biologicals or infectious agents on solid waste the term includes solid waste that is soaked with such matter and solid waste onto which such matter is dried and caked 6 cultures means cultures and stocks of infectious agents and associated biologicals including cultures from medical and pathological laboratories research and industrial laboratories waste from the production of biologicals discarded live and attenuated vaccines and cultures dishes and devices used to transfer inoculate and mix cultures 7 facility or generators facility means all contiguous land and structures and other appurtenances and improvements at the location where a generator conducts or performs those acts and process procedures which produce infectious medical waste 8 generator means a person firm or corporation whose act or process procedures produces infectious medical waste in the case where more than one generator is located in one building operating independently each individual is a separate generator in the case where several generators work for a single institution eg a hospital the institution is the generator examples of generators include but are not limited to a hospitals and clinics  b physicians dentists podiatrists chiropractors and any professional licensed under the illinois medical licensing act or other professionals who diagnose and treat human beings  c medical diagnostic laboratories  d blood banks and plasma centers  e ambulatory surgical facilities  f longterm health care facilities  g research or analytical laboratories  h pharmaceutical facilities  i veterinaries and veterinary hospitals and clinics  j mortuaries  and k animal quarantine facilities 9 infectious agent means any organism that is capable of being communicated by invasion of and multiplication in body tissues and capable of causing disease or adverse health impacts in humans or animals 10 infectious medical waste means waste that is generated in the diagnosis treatment or immunization of human beings and animals or in the research pertaining thereto or in the production and testing of biologicals or the collection and distribution of blood supplies which may be capable of transmitting a communicable disease infectious medical waste includes but is not limited to the following a pathological waste  b cultures  c sharps  d biologicals  e blood and blood products  f human body parts and contaminated disposable bedding bandages and dressings  g contaminated laboratory wastes  h wastes from surgery and autopsy  i animal carcasses animal body parts and body fluids and contaminated bedding  and j isolation wastes 11 isolation waste means biological wastes and discarded materials contaminated with blood excretia exudates or secretions from humans who are isolated to protect others from certain highly communicable diseases or isolated animals known to be infected with highly communicable diseases 12 laboratory means any research analytical or clinical facility that performs health care related analysis or service this includes medical pathological pharmaceutical and other research commercial or industrial laboratories 13 liquid infectious medical waste means liquid waste that is included with solid infectious medical waste for treatment and disposal it does not include urine wash water and other liquids more properly disposed of via the sanitary sewer 14 pathological waste means body tissues organs and body parts and body fluids removed during medical procedures and specimens of body fluids and their containers 15 regulatory authority means village of wheeling acting village sanitarian or his designee 16 secure area means an area within the generators facility which is accessible only to the generator and employees trained to handle infectious medical wastes if indoors the area must not be accessible to the general public if outdoors the area must be covered and locked 17 sharps means hypodermic needles suture needles syringes with or without the attached needle pasteur pipettes scalpel blades blood vials needles with attached tubing and culture dishes regardless of presence of infectious agents that have been used in animal or human patient care or treatment or in medical research or industrial laboratories also included are other types of broken or unbroken glassware that were in contact with infectious agents such as used slides and cover slips 18 transportation means the shipment or conveyance of infectious medical waste by air rail highway or water 19 transporter means a person engaged in the offsite transportation of infectious medical waste 20 treatment or effective treatment of infectious medical waste means any method technique or process designed to change the biological character or composition of any infectious medical waste so as to reduce the pathogenic qualities or eliminate its potential for causing disease to be effective the treatment must be designed for the waste the question the treatment may include but is not limited to the following a incineration  b steam sterilization autoclaving  c chemical disinfection  d thermal inactivation  e irradiation 21 universal biohazard symbol means the symbol design that conforms to the design shown in 29 cfr f8ii 22 waste means materials which are being discarded a part 1991   duty it shall be unlawful for any person to package store transport treat or dispose of infectious medical waste in violation of the provisions of this a part 1991   protocol required generators of infectious medical waste shall establish a written protocol complying with the provisions of this specifying the procedures to be followed in the generators facility for the handling packaging storage transportation treatment and final disposal of infectious medical waste generated in the generators facility the protocol shall include procedures for 1 storage of infectious medical waste before it is treated or removed from the generators facility  2 methods of treatment if effective treatment is provided at the generators facility and quality control procedures as specified by the treatment equipments manufacturer  3 method of removal of the infectious medical waste from the generators facility including documentation of removal and if removed by a person other than the generator or generators employee evidence that the person so removing the infectious medical waste in licensed to do so  4 final disposal method  and 5 retention of records as required in this a part 1991   records required a the generator shall maintain at the facility and make available to the regulatory authority upon request the following records 1 the written protocol  2 a generators log showing dates that generator removed and transported infectious medical waste to a treatment or disposal facility  3 receipts from the licensed waste haulers who have removed the waste for transportation to a treatment or disposal facility or from the treatment or disposal facility to which the infectious medical waste was delivered  and 4 the name address telephone number and if applicable the license number of the hauler removing the infectious medical waste or the treatment or disposal facility to which the infectious medical waste was delivered b the generator shall maintain at the facility the required records for a minimum of thirtysix months a part 1991   receipts required the generator shall obtain a receipt from the hauler which removes the infectious medical waste from the generators facility or the treatment or disposal facility to which the generator delivers the infectious medical waste such receipts shall be maintained for thirtysix months a part 1991   storage a infectious medical waste which is being stored prior to being effectively treated at the generators facility or being stored prior to removal by a licensed waste hauler or the generator shall be packaged according to the provisions of this stored in a secure area b each container of infectious waste shall be individually marked with the universal biohazard symbol a part 1991   storage duration infectious medical waste which can putrefy and generate noxious odors shall be stored for no longer than seven days at temperatures above fifteen degrees fahrenheit or no longer than thirty days at temperatures of fifteen degrees fahrenheit or below all other infectious medical waste shall be stored for the shortest possible time but in no case shall it be stored longer than thirty days a part 1991   packaging infectious medical waste shall be packaged in the following manner 1 liquid shall be placed in a leakproof container before being bagged boxed or placed in a drum  2 sharps shall be placed in a punctureresistant container which is nonopenable except by use of tools before being bagged boxed or placed in a drum  3 all waste shall be placed in sealed tearresistant plastic bags identified by the universal biohazard symbol the bags shall be thick enough to contain any liquid infectious waste which may spill or leak into it  and 4 all waste shall be placed in a second bag box or drum identified with the universal biohazard symbol if the treatment process destroyed the biohazard symbol or reduced the structural integrity of the original container a part 1991   treatment the generator may provide effective treatment at the generators facility if so the generator shall conduct quality assurance checks as specified by the treatment equipment manufacturer on the waste and equipment and retain the records of the checks for thirtysix months a part 1991   transportation infectious medical waste shall be transported from the generators facility to the treatment or final disposal facility by an illinois environmental protection agency licensed special waste hauler except that the generator or an employee of the generator may transport the infectious medical waste to the treatment or final disposal facility if the infectious medical waste is transported to the treatment or final disposal facility by an employee of the generator the generator shall be jointly liable for violations of this by the employee a part 1991   final disposal final disposal of infectious medical waste both treated and untreated shall be in a sanitary landfill or an incinerator approved by the united states environmental protection agency to accept infectious or medical wastes a part 1991   exemptions waste generated by an individuals self treatment shall be exempt from the provisions of this except that sharps so generated shall be securely packaged in a sealed leakproof rigid puncture proof container prior to disposal a part 1991   penalties each violation of a provision of this be punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars each day a violation of any provision of this shall be deemed to be a separate offense a part 1991 vital statistics registrar of vital statistics the village clerk shall be and is hereby made registrar of vital statistics for the village 1956    reports required a report of all births stillbirths and deaths shall be made to the local registrar of vital statistics which report shall contain all information required by law 1956    record of vital statistics the registrar shall keep a record showing all births stillbirths and deaths occurring within the village which record shall include the information required to be kept by statute 1956    statutory rule the provisions of the statutes relative to vital statistics shall be fully complied with by the village clerk in connection with vital statistic reports the village clerk shall make or cause to be made sufficient copies of all such records so that one complete set thereof may be retained and kept by the village 1956   registration of vital statistics provided for by statutesee sha ch 111 12  36 et seq   penalty for violation any person firm or corporation violating the provisions of this guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as provided in each day that a violation is permitted to exist constitutes a separate offense x  a part 1965 municipal solid waste system definitions the terms defined in this section shall have the meanings prescribed herein agency means the solid waste agency of northern cook county person means any natural individual firm trust estate partnership association joint stock company joint venture or corporation or a receiver trustee conservator or other representative appointed by forth in  1 comply with all the laws ordinances rules and regulations pertaining to the collection transportation and disposal of system waste as may be enacted from time to time by any lawful maintain all equipment used to collect transport and dispose of system waste in good repair and working order and operate it efficiently and effectively  4 collect as agent for and promptly pay to the village all rates and charges imposed by the village or agency on persons using the municipal solid waste system  5 maintain accurate books and records and make them available to the village upon demand  6 identify pursuant to agency rules vehicles used to transport system waste  7 to operate in a safe manner assuring to the greatest extent possible safety to the lives and property of all within ten days of said change b part 1992   the municipal waste system fundimposition of rates and charges a there is hereby created and established an enterprise fund of the village known as the municipal solid waste system fund which shall be separate and apart from all other fund and accounts of the village as provided in subsection g of this section b as part of the regular budget process the village manager shall recommend and the president and board of trustees shall adopt a budget for the municipal solid waste system the budget shall estimate the revenue required to 1 pay all operating and maintenance expenses of the municipal solid waste system including all obligations to the agency under the project use agreement  2 pay as they become due interest on and principal of any revenue bonds or other obligations payable from the revenues of the municipal solid waste system  3 provide for all unpaid claims  and 4 maintain appropriate depreciation and reserve funds including reserves for uncollected charges the budget shall estimate the amounts available to pay those obligations from 1 taxes levied and anticipated to be collected pursuant to law  2 other amounts deposited in the municipal solid waste system fund  and 3 rates and charges to be imposed on persons disposing of system waste municipal solid waste system c the rates and charges imposed for use of the municipal solid waste system shall be sufficient after taking into account monies then on hand in the municipal solid waste system fund and the proceeds of taxes levied and to be collected which have been assigned and pledged to the municipal solid waste system fund 1 to pay all operation and maintenance expenses of the municipal solid waste system including all obligations to the agency under the terms of the project use agreement  2 to pay as they become due interest on and principal of any revenue bonds or other obligations payable from revenues of the municipal solid waste system  3 to provide for all unpaid claims  and 4 to provide adequate depreciation and reserve funds for the municipal solid waste system including reserves for uncollected charges d the village shall prepare and deliver a monthly bill setting forth the estimated or actual amount of charges for use of the municipal solid waste system the bill for each month shall be paid no later than twenty days from the date of said bill a late charge of three percent shall be paid on all amounts due and unpaid on the due date in the event all amounts due including any late charges are not paid by the end of the month in which they are due interest shall be charged on all such unpaid amounts at the rate of one percent per month or portion of a month which interest shall accrue beginning with the first day of the calendar month after the due date e in addition to the right to receive a late charge and interest the village reserves all other rights and remedies it may have at law or in equity including but not by the way of limitation revocation of license election of any remedy shall not be waiver of any other remedy f the owners and occupants of residential real estate within the village served by the municipal solid waste system shall be jointly and severally liable to pay all rates and charges imposed by the village pursuant to the provisions of this g all amounts collected from rates and charges imposed under this section shall be deposited in the municipal solid waste system fund and together with all other amounts deposited in the municipal solid waste system fund shall be separate and apart from all other monies of the municipality except amounts deposited in the municipal waste system fund may be invested together with other funds of the village b part 1992 garbage and refuse shall be the duty of every person in possession of any premises to cause all refuse produced on the premises to be securely wrapped or bound and placed in approved refuse receptacles as specified in in such manner as may be necessary to prevent the same from being scattered spilled or blown away all refuse of a size or nature which renders it unsuitable for deposit in approved refuse receptacles shall be placed on the ground adjacent to the receptacles in neat and orderly bundles or stacks not to exceed seventy pounds in weight and four feet in length except as otherwise provided in this refuse which is by its size or nature rendered unsuitable for deposit into an approved receptacle shall be called for and removed by a licensed scavenger service within seven days of being discarded a or other liquids which may be on the solid waste from leaking into the environment and scrap or waste stored therein shall be stored so as to prevent the contents from being disseminated by the elements the owner operator occupant or person in control of the property or a part thereof shall store the receptacle inside a completely enclosed building or shall provide a rainproof weatherproof and waterproof cover on or over the receptacle and shall not install holes in the receptacle to drain the water out the owner operator occupant or person in control of the property or a part thereof emptied and its contents removed on a schedule or frequency similar to the schedule or frequency on which the contents of the refuse receptacles is are removed but not less frequently than once each month c the number and size of receptacles required in subsections a and b of this section shall be sufficient to completely contain all refuse generated at the premises between scavenger service pick village except in approved receptacles litter must be deposited in approved receptacles in such a manner as to prevent it from being carried or deposited by the elements upon any street sidewalk or other public place b part 1980   sweeping into public placesduty to keep sidewalk clean no person shall sweep into or deposit in any gutter street or other public place within the village any accumulation of litter from any building or lot from any public or private sidewalk or driveway persons owning or occupying property shall keep the sidewalk and parkways in front of their premises free of litter b part 1980   merchants to keep sidewalks public places free of litter a no person owning or occupying a place of business shall sweep into or deposit in any gutter street or other public place any accumulation of litter from any building or lot or from any public or private sidewalk driveway or parking lot persons owning or occupying places of business shall keep the sidewalk and parkway in front of their business premises free of litter b persons owning or occupying places of business within the village shall keep the premises under their control free of litter except in approved receptacles b part 1980   littering bodies of water no person shall throw or deposit litter or any other material which could cause an obstruction to waterflow in any channel storm sewer creek stream waterway detention or retention pond or any other body of water within the village of wheeling a 1990 b part 1980   littering construction sites no person firm or corporation shall throw deposit or discard litter or permit it to be thrown deposited or discarded on any construction site except in approved receptacles litter must be deposited in approved receptacles in a manner as to prevent it from being carried or deposited by the elements on any public place or on private property b part 1980   general contractors responsibility to maintain premises free of litter no person generally responsible for construction at a construction site shall allow litter to accumulate on a construction site except in approved litter receptacles such persons shall provide approved receptacles on the construction premises to contain all litter generated between collections by a scavenger service licensed by the village b part 1980   duty to maintain premises free of litter the collection b part 1980   throwing distributing commercial handbills in public places no person shall throw deposit or discard any commercial or noncommercial handbill in or upon any sidewalk street or premises or the distribution of noncommercial handbills in common areas open to the general public within shopping centers or malls provided such distribution complies with subsection b b manner of distribution no person shall throw deposit or distribute any handbill in or upon private premises except by handing or transmitting such handbill directly to the owner occupant or other person present deposit those handbills in approved receptacles or retain them in a manner not violative of this shall be deposited in approved receptacles in such a manner as to prevent them from being carried by the elements into any public place or private property b part 1980   throwing litter from vehicles no person shall throw deposit or discard any litter from a moving vehicle or permit such activity in wheeling as a litter or waste disposal site and the litter is disposed of in accord with the applicable rules and regulations governing disposal on that site  or 3 when the person is acting under the direction of authorized state or village officials during special cleanup days or projects authorized by the village or by the appropriate state agency  or 4 the person is acting or reacting lawfully to an emergency situation where health or safety is threatened and removes and properly disposes of such litter when the emergency situation no longer exists b part 1980   vehicles emitting litter a no person shall drive tow or cause to be driven or towed any truck van trailer or other vehicle containing loose loads of material on the public streets highways roads alleys or other public ways unless such load is fully enclosed and covered or otherwise secured to prevent such material from being dropped blown or otherwise deposited on any such public way or on any public place b no vehicle shall be driven or towed on the public streets highways roads alleys or other public ways from which loose materials or liquids other than water are released dropped blown or otherwise deposited on a public way or public place except with the prior approval of the proper village or state officials for public purposes c it shall be an affirmative defense to a charge of violating subsections a and b of this section that all reasonable efforts were made to secure the load and to prevent material from being deposited on public ways and places  and that any materials which were released dropped blown or otherwise deposited were de minimus in quantity nontoxic and nonreactive in quality and that their presence on the public ways or places did not create any hazard or nuisance or injury to persons or property b part 1980   penalties any person violating any provision of this be fined not less than ten dollars nor more than two hundred dollars for the first such offense any person violating any provision of this be subject to a fine of not less than twentyfive dollars nor more than two hundred dollars for the second such violation and a fine of not less than fifty dollars nor more than two hundred dollars for the third and subsequent violations within a oneyear period each act of littering by unlawfully depositing throwing or discarding a distinct item shall be a separate offense each day in which a person violates a duty imposed by this or continues to maintain property or equipment or to utilize equipment or receptacles in a condition or manner in violation of this shall constitute a separate offense b part 1980 trailers definitions for the purpose of this words and phrases are defined as follow the term housecar trailer is defined to be any structure for or used for living or sleeping purposes mounted upon wheels and capable of being transported from place to place either by its own power or by some vehicle attached to it  provided however that this definition shall not apply to any vehicle operated over fixed rails the term trailer camp is defined to be a vacant or improved plot of ground where two or more housecar trailers used as living or sleeping quarters may be located regardless of whether or not a charge is made for such accommodation the term person is defined to be any person firm or corporation 1956    trailer camps prohibited it is unlawful for any person to maintain or operate any plot of ground as a trailer camp for human habitation within the village of wheeling 1956    housecar trailers prohibited it is unlawful for any person to maintain any housecar trailer within the village of wheeling whether used for living or sleeping purposes or whether such housecar trailer is vacant and not used for living or sleeping purposes and is being merely stored 1956    wheels of housecar trailer not to be removed it is unlawful for any person to remove the wheels or other transporting device from any housecar trailer or to otherwise fix said housecar trailer to the ground so as to prevent ready removal of said trailer 1956    penalty for violations any person firm or corporation violating the provisions of this guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as provided in chapter 104 each day that a violation is permitted to exist constitutes a separate offense a part 1965 barber cosmetology manicure and pedicure establishments definitions for the purpose of this the terms used herein are defined as follows a barber cosmetology esthetics manicure and pedicure establishments means any establishment in which one or more persons are engaged in the practice of shaving or trimming the beard or cutting the hair  any practice for the purpose of styling dressing curling waving straightening cleaning singeing depilating shampooing marcelling chemically restructuring bleaching tinting coloring shaping the hair  any practice for the purpose of cleaning massaging or toning the skin of the scalp face or neck  any practice or professional treatment of hands and feet and fingernails and toenails for removing cuticles trimming and shaping nails  any practice for the purpose of applying cosmetic makeup to the face or neck of any person b person in charge means the individual present in the facility who is the apparent supervisor of the facility at the time of the inspection if no individual is the apparent supervisor then any employee present is the person in charge a part 2002   structural requirements barber cosmetology esthetics manicure and pedicure establishments shall comply with the following requirements a floors floor coverings and walls in areas where hair is cut or washed and toilet rooms shall be constructed of smooth easily cleanable and nonabsorbent material b permanently fixed artificial light sources shall provide a minimum of thirty foot candles of light in customer service areas permanently fixed light sources shall provide a minimum of fifteen foot candles of light in all other areas of the facility c the ventilation shall be designed and operated in a manner to remove the presence of any detectable fumes or noxious odors d the plumbing shall be sized installed and maintained in accordance with the latest plumbing code as adopted by ordinance by the village of wheeling hot and cold running water shall be provided under pressure to all fixtures at all times e toilet fixtures shall be of a sanitary design and readily cleanable toilet facilities including rooms and fixtures shall be kept in clean condition and in good repair toilet tissue shall be provided at all times easily cleanable receptacles shall be provided for waste material and such receptacles in toilet rooms for woman shall be covered f lavatories shall be at least the minimum required by law a lavatory shall also be located within the hair cutting area and nail treatment areas lavatories shall be located to permit convenient use by all employees before serving a patron each lavatory shall be provided with a supply of liquid or powder handcleaning soap and a supply of sanitary towels or handdrying device and a refuse container a part 2002   sanitary requirements barber cosmetology esthetics manicure and pedicure establishments shall comply with the following requirements a employee outer clothing shall be clean and sanitary b employees shall thoroughly was their hands immediately before serving a patron and immediately after using the toilet patrons shall wash their hands before receiving any nail treatments c soiled linens shall be stored in covered nonabsorbent containers or washable laundry bags all soiled towels and linens shall be laundered at a commercial laundry facility or on the premises d all powders lotions creams and other cosmetics shall be kept in clean covered containers that are properly labeled and shall be dispensed in a sanitary manner using single use applicators only alum or other astringents used to stop the flow of blood shall be applied in powdered or liquid form only the stick form shall not be used e clean towels shall be stored in a sanitary manner employees shall use separate and clean towels for each patron unless a separate and clean apron or cape is used for each patron a separate and clean towel or fresh paper shall be placed around the neck to prevent the apron or cape from touching the skin headrests shall be covered with a clean towel or fresh paper for each patron or they may be thoroughly sanitized after each patron f all implements instruments equipment and furniture including combs brushes scissors tweezers razors headrest neck dusters shears head coverings hairpins bobby pins curlers etc used in barber cosmetology manicure and pedicure establishments shall be thoroughly cleaned and sanitized after having been used on or in contact with a patron and shall be stored in a sanitary manner thereafter all sanitizing barbicidal or germicidal solutions shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers instructions nail brushes are prohibited unless they are disposable g barber cosmetology manicure and pedicure establishments shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition floors walls furniture equipment and other fixtures shall be kept clean and in good repair hair droppings shall be stored in a covered waste container and disposed of as often as necessary to prevent the creation of any nuisance h no animals or pets shall be kept in or allowed to enter a barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment except dogs used to assist the handicapped i effective measures shall be used to preclude the presence of insects and rodents j all persons engaged in barber cosmetology pedicure andor manicure activities must display state of illinois license in a conspicuous place preferably at the station where such person is employed upon request the operator or person in charge shall make available to the health officer or his designee any records requested to determine current personnel engaged in barber cosmetology manicure andor pedicure activities at that facility a part 2002   health and disease control of personnel a no person while afflicted with boils infected wounds sores or an acute respiratory infection shall work in any areas of the barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment in any capacity in which there is a likelihood of contaminating anything with pathogenic organisms or transmitting disease to other individuals  nor shall any service be performed on any person known to have such disease or condition b the health officer or his designee may require any or all of the following measures 1 the immediate exclusion of that person from any barber cosmetology manicure and pedicure activities 2 the adequate medical and bacteriological examination of the person of his associates and his and their body discharges a part 2002   access the health officer or his designee after presenting proper identification shall be permitted to enter any barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment at any time when the operator or employee is present for the purpose of making inspections to determine compliance with this a part 2002   inspection prior to the start of operations for any new or remodeled facility the health officer or his designee shall inspect the barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment to determine compliance with the approved plans specifications and with the requirements of this a part 2002   inspection frequency inspections of barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishments will be performed as often as necessary for enforcement of this a part 2002   inspection reports whenever an inspection of a barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment is made the findings shall be recorded on an inspection report form the inspection form shall summarize the requirements of this copy of the inspection report shall be furnished to the person in charge at the conclusion of the inspection the completed inspection report form is a public document that shall be made available for public disclosure to any person who requests it according to law a part 2002   correction of violations the completed inspection report form shall specify a reasonable period of time for the correction of violations found correction of any violations shall be accomplished within the period specified a part 2002   submission of plans a whenever a barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment is constructed altered or remodeled and whenever an existing structure is converted to use as a barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment properly prepared plans and specifications for construction altering remodeling or conversion shall be submitted to the health officer for review and approval before construction altering remodeling or conversion is begun the plans and specifications shall indicate the proposed layout arrangement construction materials of work areas mechanical plans and equipment specifications b all newly constructed converted or major remodeling including structural alterations of a barber cosmetology manicure or pedicure establishment shall conform in its construction to the requirements of this c establishments that are approved prior to the effective date of this but do not meet the design and construction standards set forth in this shall be deemed in compliance with this a part 2002   penalty any person firm or corporation violating any of the terms or provisions of this be fined not less than fifty dollars nor more than one thousand dollars each day that a violation exists shall constitute a separate offense a part 2002   alternative penalty any person accused of violating any section of the barber cosmetology manicure and pedicure ordinance may be issued an administrative citation in accordance with the procedures as established in of the wheeling municipal a part 2002 rat extermination rats the presence of any rats of any kind on any tract of land whether improved or vacant is a nuisance and it is unlawful for any owner of or person interested in private property to permit the ingress of rats to their property or to fail to exterminate rats thereon a part 1966   notice it shall be the duty of the village health officer to serve or cause to be served a notice to the owner occupant or interested person of any premises on which rats are present to demand abatement of the nuisance within ten days a part 1994 a part 1966   abatement if the person so served does not abate the nuisance within ten days the village health officer shall proceed to abate such nuisance keeping an account of the expenses of the cost of the abatement a part 1994 a part 1966   statement the director of finance shall mail a statement of the expenses incurred in exterminating the rats to the owners or occupants of the private property whenever the statement remains for a period of thirty days after it has been mailed the director of finance shall prepare and record a lien for the expenses incurred f 1977 a part 1966 j 3212011   lien within sixty days after the expense of exterminating the rats has been incurred either the director of finance or the person firm or corporation performing the service by authority of the municipality shall file or cause to be filed in his or its own name a notice of lien in the office of the cook county recorder of deeds or in the office of the registrar of titles if the real estate affected is registered under the torrens system this notice shall consist of a sworn statement setting out 1 a description of the real estate sufficient for identification thereof  2 the amount of money representing the cost and expense incurred or payable for the service  and 3 the date or dates when such cost and expense was incurred by the municipality or person firm or corporation performing the service a part 1966 j 3212011   foreclosure of lien property subject to a lien for rat extermination charges shall be sold for nonpayment of the same and the proceeds of such sale shall be applied to pay the charges after deducting costs as is the case of mortgages or mechanics liens suit to foreclose this lien shall be commenced within one year after the date of the filing of the notice of lien the attorney for the village is authorized and directed to institute such proceedings in the name of the village in any court having jurisdiction over such matter against any real property for which notice of lien has been recorded a part 1966   release upon payment of the cost and expense after notice of lien has been filed the lien shall be released by the municipality or person in whose name the lien has been filed and release shall be filed on record in the same manner as filing notice of the lien a 1966   penalty for violation any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this be fined not less than five dollars not more than five hundred dollars for each offense and a separate offense shall be deemed committed on each day during or on which a nuisance continues unabated after ten days from receipt of notice c 1966 public nuisances public nuisance defined a as used in this a public nuisance shall mean any act thing occupation condition or use property which shall continue for such length village hereby adopts the findings of the illinois general assembly as set forth in 410 ilcs 825 a part 2008   definitions for the purpose of this the following items shall have the following meanings a bar means an establishment that is devoted to the serving of alcoholic beverages for consumption by guests on the premises and that derives no more than ten percent of its gross revenue from the sale of food consumed on the premises bar includes but is not limited to taverns nightclubs cocktail lounges adult entertainment facilities and cabarets b employer means a person business partnership association or corporation including a municipal corporation trust or nonprofit entity that employs the services of one or more individual persons c employee means a person who is employed by an employer in consideration for direct or indirect monetary wages or profits or a person who volunteers his or her services for a nonprofit entity d enclosed area means all space between a floor and a ceiling that is enclosed or partially enclosed with i solid walls or windows exclusive of doorways or ii solid walls with partitions and no windows exclusive of doorways that extend from the floor to the ceiling including without limitation lobbies and corridors e enclosed or partially enclosed sports arena means any sports pavilion stadium gymnasium health spa boxing arena swimming pool roller rink ice rink bowling alley or other similar place where members of the general public assemble to engage in physical exercise or participate in athletic competitions or recreational activities or to offices of surgeons chiropractors physical therapists physicians dentists and all specialists within these professions healthcare facility includes all waiting rooms hallways private rooms semiprivate rooms and wards within healthcare facilities g place of employment means any area under the control of a public or private employer that employees are required to enter leave or pass the course of employment including but not limited to entrances and exits to places of employment including a minimum distance as set forth in this of fifteen feet from entrances exits windows that open and ventilation intakes that serve an enclosed area where smoking is prohibited  offices and work areas  restrooms  conference and classrooms  break rooms and cafeterias  and other common areas a private residence or homebased business unless used to provide licensed childcare foster care adult care or other similar social service care on the premises is not a place of employment h private club means thereof used exclusively for club purposes at all times 3 is operated solely for a recreational fraternal social patriotic political benevolent or athletic purpose but not for pecuniary gain and 4 only sells alcoholic beverages incidental to its operation for purposes of this definition private club means an organization that is managed by a board of directors executive committee or similar body chosen by the members at an annual meeting has established bylaws a constitution or both to govern its activities and has been granted an exemption from the payment of federal income tax as a club under 26 usc 501 i private residence means the part of a structure used as a dwelling including without limitation a private home townhouse condominium apartment mobile home vacation home cabin or cottage for the purposes of this definition a hotel motel inn resort lodge bed and breakfast or other similar public accommodation hospital nursing home or assisted living facility shall not be considered a private residence j public place means that portion of any building or vehicle used by and open to the public regardless of whether the building or vehicle is owned in whole or in part by private persons or entities the state of illinois or any other public entity and regardless of whether a fee is charged for admission including a minimum distance as set forth in this of fifteen feet from entrances exits windows that open and ventilation intakes that serve an enclosed area where smoking is prohibited a public place does not include a private residence unless the private residence part 2008   prohibition in public places places of employment and governmental vehicles no person shall smoke in a public place or in any place of employment or within fifteen feet of any entrance to a public place or place of employment no person may smoke in any vehicle owned leased or operated by the village smoking is prohibited in indoor public places and workplaces unless specifically exempted by this a part 2008   posting of signsremoval of ashtrays a no smoking signs or the international no smoking symbol consisting of a pictorial representation of a burning cigarette enclosed in a red circle with a red bar across it shall be clearly and conspicuously posted in each public place and place of employment where smoking is prohibited by this the owner operator manager or other person in control of that place b each public place and place of employment where smoking is prohibited by this have posted at every entrance a conspicuous sign clearly stating that smoking is prohibited c all ashtrays shall be removed from any area where smoking is prohibited by this the owner operator manager or other person having control of the area a part 2008   smoking prohibited in dormitories notwithstanding any other provision of this smoking is prohibited in any portion of the living quarters including but not limited to sleeping rooms dining areas restrooms laundry areas lobbies and hallways of a building used in whole or in part as a student dormitory that is owned and operated or otherwise utilized by a public or private institution of higher education a part 2008   designation of other nonsmoking areas notwithstanding any other provision of this act any employer owner occupant lessee operator manager or other person in control of any public place or place of employment may designate a nonenclosed area of a public place or place of employment including outdoor areas as an area where smoking is also prohibited provided that such employer owner lessee or occupant shall conspicuously post signs prohibiting smoking in the manner described in subsections a and b of this a part 2008   exemptions notwithstanding any other provision of this smoking is allowed in the following areas a private residences or dwelling places except when used as a childcare adult day care or healthcare facility or any other homebased business open to the public b retail tobacco stores as defined in this to the  the retail tobacco store shall annually file with the wheeling village clerk by january 31st of each year including 200 an affidavit stating the percentage of its gross income derived from the sale of loose tobacco plants or herbs and cigars cigarettes pipes and other smoking devices for burning tobacco and related smoking accessories any retail tobacco store that begins operation after the effective date of this amendatory act may only qualify for an exemption if located in a freestanding structure occupied solely by the business and smoke from the business does not migrate into an enclosed area where smoking is prohibited c private and semiprivate rooms in nursing homes and longterm care facilities that are occupied by one or more persons all of whom are smokers and have requested in writing to be placed or to remain in a room where smoking is permitted and the smoke shall not infiltrate other areas of the nursing home d hotel and motel sleeping rooms that are rented to guests and are designated as smoking rooms provided that all smoking rooms on the same floor must be contiguous and smoke from these rooms must not infiltrate into nonsmoking rooms or other areas where smoking is prohibited not more than twentyfive percent of the rooms rented to guests in a hotel or motel may be designated as rooms where smoking is allowed the status of rooms as smoking or nonsmoking may not be changed except to permanently add additional nonsmoking rooms a part 2008   violations a person corporation partnership association or other entity who violates this be fined pursuant to this section each day that a violation occurs is a separate violation a person who smokes in an area where smoking is prohibited under this be fined in an amount that is not less than one hundred dollars and not more than two hundred fifty dollars a person who owns operates or otherwise controls a public place or place of employment that violates this be fined i not less than two hundred fifty dollars for the first violation ii not less than five hundred dollars for the second violation within one year after the first violation and iii not less than two thousand five hundred dollars for each additional violation within one year after the first violation a part 2008   injunctions the village may institute in a circuit court an action to enjoin violations of this take place within the villages corporate boundaries a part 2008   severability if any provision clause or paragraph of this be held invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction such validity shall not affect the other provisions of this a part 2008   entrances exits windows and ventilation intakes smoking is prohibited within a minimum distance of fifteen feet from entrances exits windows that open and ventilation intakes that serve an enclosed area where smoking is prohibited under this as to ensure that tobacco smoke does not enter the area exits open windows or other vacation if applicable under the employees employment agreement  or 2 to be excused from work without pay and without discipline or other penalty  or 3 to elect to take the day off with pay in order to practice the employees religious beliefs and to make up the lost work time at a time and date consistent with the operational needs of the employers business any employee who elects such deferred work shall be compensated at his or her regular rate of pay regardless of the time and date at which the work is made up the employer may require that any employee who plans to exercise option 3 of this paragraph provide the employer with notice of the employees intention to do so no less than five days prior to the date of absence a part 1995   sexual harassment no employer shall engage in shall willfully interfere with the performance of a duty or the exercise of a power by the commission or one of its members or staff a part 1995 title 7  animals chapters animalsgeneral provisions purpose it is the purpose of this title to protect animals from abuse neglect or rabies  provide for security of persons from annoyance intimidation injury or rabies by animals  encourage responsible pet ownership and animal population control  and establish a method of response to situations involving animals a part 1991   definitions for purposes of this the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall have the meanings set forth herein 1 animal means any living vertebrate creature either domesticated or wild excluding humans 2 bite means seizing with the teeth or jaws or scratching by the teeth which wounds or pierces the skin 3 cat means all members of the family felidae 4 dangerous animal means a any individual animal when unmuzzled unleashed or unattended by its owner or custodian that behaves in a manner that a reasonable person would believe poses a serious and unjustified imminent threat of serious physical injury or death to a person or a companion animal on either public or private property  or b any animal with a known propensity tendency or disposition to attack unprovoked to cause injury to or otherwise threaten the safety of human beings or domestic animals  or c any animal which because of its size physical nature or vicious propensity is capable of inflicting serious physical harm or death to humans  or d any animal which without provocation attacks or bites or has attacked or bitten a human being or domestic animal  or e any animal owned or harbored primarily or in part for the purpose of fighting or any animal trained for fighting 5 diseased animal shall refer to any animal infected with a contagious or infectious disease including those diseases contagious or infectious only to animals 6 dwelling unit means a structure or portion thereof designed and built as a complete selfsufficient living facility for one family including permanent provisions for sleeping eating cooking and sanitation units in a hotel or motel are not to be counted as dwelling units 7 family means a an individual or two or more persons related by blood marriage or adoption and including not more than two boarders or lodgers living together as a single housekeeping unit in a dwelling unit  or b a group of not more than four persons who need not be related by blood marriage or adoption living together as a single housekeeping unit  plus in either case  or c a group of not more than eight persons with developmental disabilities who need not be related by blood marriage or adoption living together as a single housekeeping unit in a dwelling unit  plus in all cases usual domestic servants or attendant support staff 8 guide dog or companion animal means any dog trained by a recognized organization to lead the legally blind or deaf  or any animal trained by a recognized organization to assist in the daily activities of a physically handicapped person 9 impounded means taken into the custody of the public animal control facility in the city town or county where the animal is found 10 keep or harbor means to maintain possess control and use 11 kennel means any establishment where more than four dogs or four cats or any combination thereof over four months of age are maintained for boarding training or similar purposes for a fee or compensation  or offered for sale exchange or adoption with or without charge those dogs or cats which are produced and raised by the operation of such kennel kennel shall not include veterinary hospitals pet shops or shelters 12 leash means a strong cord thong or chain not more than six feet in length for the purpose of keeping an animal under control 13 multiplefamily dwelling means a building containing two or more dwelling units whose residents live independently of one another 14 owner means any person having the right of property in an animal who keeps or harbors an animal who has an animal in its care acts as its custodian or who knowingly permits any animal to remain on or about any premises occupied by him excluding native wildlife remaining on or about the premises 15 person means any natural person partnership trust corporation association or other legal entity whenever used with respect to any penalty the term person as applied to partnerships or associations shall mean the partners or members thereof and as applied to trusts or corporations shall mean the trustees or officers thereof 16 pet shops means any facility which sells offers for sale exchange or adoption with or without charge or donation any dog cat or other animal 17 physical injury means the impairment of physical condition 18 proper control means secured by a leash or lead or within the premises of its owner or confined within a crate cage or fenced area or confined within a vehicle or within the premises of another person with the consent of such person 19 pound or animal control facility may be used interchangeably and mean any facility operated by or under contract for the state county or municipal corporation or political subdivision of the state of illinois or approved by the county administrator for the purpose of impounding or harboring seized stray homeless abandoned or unwanted dogs cats or other animals 20 running at large means off the premises of the owner of the animal and not under the proper control of the owner 21 serious physical injury means a physical injury that creates a substantial risk of death or that causes death serious or protracted disfigurement protracted impairment of health impairment of the function of any bodily organ or plastic surgery 22 singlefamily dwelling means a building containing one dwelling unit only 23 shelter means a facility operated owned or maintained by a duly incorporated humane society animal welfare society or other nonprofit organization for the purpose of providing for and promoting welfare protection and humane treatment of animals 24 vaccination against rabies means the confined in a building or secure enclosure on the owners property or upon a leash and attended in such a manner that the animal cannot come into contact with a male animal except for planned breeding purposes a part 1991   noise disturbance it shall be unlawful to harbor or keep any animal which creates excessive or untimely noise causing annoyance and discomfort to surrounding neighbors or person so as to disturb the reasonable use and enjoyment of property a part 1991   limitation on number of animals a it shall be unlawful for any person persons or family to keep harbor or permit more than
