with said singlefamily dwelling within the village except as may be provided herein b it shall be unlawful for any person persons or family to keep harbor or permit more than four of any type or combination of animals over the age of four months to be or remain in or about any multiplefamily dwelling including but not limited to any garage yard or other structure associated with said multiplefamily dwelling within the village except as may be provided herein c it shall be unlawful for any person persons or family to keep harbor or permit more than six birds to be or remain in or about any multiplefamily dwelling or singlefamily dwelling including but not limited to any garage yard or other structure associated with said singlefamily or multiplefamily dwelling within the village except as may be provided herein d the limitations of this section shall not apply to fish which are kept in an aquarium or pond e any person persons or family that is subject to regulations of a homeowner association or lease agreement shall be responsible for complying with said regulations with respect to the quantity type and size of animals f the limitations of this section shall not apply to properly established and zoned veterinary hospitals pet shops pounds or animal shelters a part 1991  5182009  a 172019   diseased animals a it shall be unlawful for any person to allow an animal afflicted with a contagious or infectious disease to be exposed in any public place whereby the health of a human being or animal may be affected  nor shall such diseased animal be shipped or removed from the premises of the owner or person in control of such animal except under the supervision of a veterinarian licensed by the state of illinois or by the illinois department of agriculture animal welfare division b it is the duty of the owner or person in control of any diseased animal to secure the disposal of such diseased animal and treatment of the affected premises so as to prevent the communication and spread of contagious or infectious diseases from such animal in conformance with state law and the rules and regulations adopted thereto a part 1991   animal bites a any person knowing that an individual has been bitten by an animal shall notify the wheeling police department within twentyfour hours of the bite occurrence upon notice the police officer or community service officer shall complete a police report and the cook county animal bite report and transmit said documents to the cook county animal control department ccacd b upon notice of a bite occurrence the owner of the biting animal shall confine the biting animal under the observation of a veterinarian licensed by the state of illinois for a period of ten days beginning within twentyfour hours of the biting incident the biting animal may be confined in the house of its owner in a manner which will prohibit it from biting any person or animal if the licensed veterinarian judges such confinement satisfactory 1 if the biting animal is currently vaccinated against rabies vaccine the animals health shall be reported by the veterinarian to the ccacd on the first and tenth days of the observation period for rabies 2 if the biting animal is not currently vaccinated against rabies the animals health condition shall be reported by the veterinarian to the ccacd on the first fifth and tenth days of the observation period for rabies c confirmation of the health of the biting animal shall be sent by the veterinarian to the ccacd within twentyfour hours of the first and final examination on forms provided by the ccacd d when an animal confined for biting shows signs of rabies or acts in a manner which would lead a person to believe that an animal may have rabies the owner or veterinarian shall notify ccacd immediately by telephone or in person of those signs e if the animal confined is determined not to be affected with rabies at the end of the period of confinement it shall be released from quarantine the animal owner shall show proof of rabies inoculation for cats and dogs and shall pay any fee charge or penalty including any fee for the veterinarian services attributed to the bite the confined animal when not redeemed by the owner may be disposed of in accordance with illinois law f it shall be unlawful for the owner of a biting animal to euthanize sell give away or otherwise dispose of an animal known to have bitten a person or have the animal vaccinated against rabies until it has been released from confinement for observation of rabies by the examining state of illinois licensed veterinarian a part 1991   procedure upon suspicion of rabies a the owner of an animal which shows signs of rabies or acts in a manner which would reasonably lead a person to believe such animal may have rabies shall notify the wheeling police department immediately by telephone or in person every veterinarian or other persons discovering or suspecting an animal to be suffering with rabies shall report such fact to the wheeling police department giving the name address and telephone number of the owner and the animal license number if known the police officer or community service officer shall immediately notify the ccacd by telephone and follow up by mailing a written report to the ccacd the owner of such animal shall immediately submit the animal to a veterinarian licensed by the state of illinois for examination and confinement at the owners expense the veterinarian shall report the health condition of the animal to the ccacd after the first fifth and tenth day of the animals confinement for rabies observation b when the animal confined is determined to be infected with rabies by the examining veterinarian the veterinarian shall notify the ccacd who shall order the animal humanely destroyed in accordance with state law and applicable rules and regulations any animal which is capable of transmitting rabies that has direct contact with the rabid animal whether or not the exposed animal has been vaccinated against rabies shall be confined for ten days under the observation of a veterinarian licensed by the state of illinois and who shall file an appropriate report to the ccacd the ccacd may order the exposed animal euthanized if any animal should die during the interval of observation for rabies the intact brain of the animal shall be forthwith delivered to the laboratory of the state department of public health c if the animal confined is determined not to be infected with rabies at the end of the period of confinement it shall be released to its owner upon the owner presenting proof of a current rabies vaccination certificate and payment of any fees charged or penalty including any fee for veterinarian services if the animal is not redeemed by the owner the animal may be disposed of in accordance with illinois law d when a case of rabies has occurred in the village of wheeling or whenever the proper officials of the village government are apprehensive of the spread of rabies the village officials may petition the ccacd to act in accordance with state law and rules and regulations of the illinois department of agriculture a part offenses against public morals   obscenity a prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to commit obscenity a person commits obscenity when with knowledge of the nature or content thereof he 1 sells delivers or provides or offers or agrees to sell deliver or provide any obscene writing picture record or other representation or embodiment of the obscene  or 2 presents or directs an obscene play dance or other performance or participates directly in that portion thereof which makes it obscene  or 3 publishes exhibits or otherwise makes available anything obscene  or 4 performs an obscene act or otherwise presents an obscene exhibition of his body for gain  or 5 creates buys procures or possesses obscene matter or material with the intent to disseminate it in violation of this section or of the penal laws or regulations of any other jurisdiction  or 6 advertises or otherwise promotes the sale of material represented or held out by him to be obscene whether or not it is obscene b obscene defined a thing is obscene if considered as a whole its predominant appeal is to prurient interest  that is a shameful or morbid interest in nudity sex or excretion and if it goes substantially beyond customary limits of candor in description or representation of such matters a thing is obscene even though the obscenity is latent as in the case of undeveloped photographs c interpretation of evidence obscenity shall be judged with reference to ordinary adults except that it shall be judged with reference to children or other specially susceptible audiences if it appears from the character of the material or the circumstances of its dissemination to be specially designed for or directed to such an audience where circumstances of production presentation sale dissemination distribution or publicity indicate that material is being commercially exploited for the sake of its prurient appeal such evidence is probative to the nature of the matter and can justify the conclusion that the matter is utterly without redeeming social importance in any prosecution for an offense under this section evidence shall be admissible to show 1 the character of the audience for which the material was designed or to which it was directed  2 what the predominant appeal of the material would be for ordinary adults or a special audience and what effect if any it would probably have on the behavior of such people  3 the artistic literary scientific educational or other merits of the material or the absence thereof  4 the degree if any of public acceptance of the material in this state  5 appeal to prurient interest or absence thereof in advertising or other promotion of the material  6 purpose of the author creator publisher or disseminator d prima facie evidence the creation purchase procurement or possession of a mold engraved plate or other embodiment of obscenity specially adapted for reproducing multiple copies or the possession of more than three copies of obscene material shall be prima facie evidence of an intent to disseminate e affirmative defenses it shall be an affirmative defense to obscenity that the dissemination 1 was not for gain and was made to personal associates other than children under eighteen years of age  2 was to institutions or individuals having scientific or other special justification for possession of such material e part 1986   dissemination of harmful material a elements of the offense a person commits the offense of dissemination of harmful material who with knowledge that a person is a child that is a person under eighteen years of age or who fails to exercise reasonable care in ascertaining the true age of a child knowingly distributes to or sends or causes to be sent to or exhibits to or offers to distribute or exhibit any harmful material to a child b definitions 1 material is harmful if to the average person applying contemporary standards its predominant appeal taken as a whole is to prurient interest that is a shameful or morbid interest in nudity sex or excrement which goes substantially beyond customary limits of candor in description or representation of such matters and is material the redeeming social importance of which is substantially less than its prurient appeal 2 material as used in this section means any writing picture record or other representation or embodiment 3 distribute means to transfer possession of whether with or without consideration 4 knowingly as used in this section means having knowledge of the contents of the subject matter or recklessly failing to exercise reasonable inspection which would have disclosed the contents thereof c interpretation of evidence 1 the predominant appeal to prurient interest of the material shall be judged with reference to average children of the same general age of the child to whom such material was offered distributed sent or exhibited unless it appears from the nature of the matter or the circumstances of its dissemination distribution or exhibition that it is designed for specially susceptible groups in which case the predominant appeal of the material shall be judged with reference to its intended or probable recipient group 2 in prosecutions under this section where circumstances of production presentation sale dissemination distribution or publicity indicates the material is being commercially exploited for the sake of its prurient appeal such evidence is probative with respect to the nature of the material and can justify the conclusion that the redeeming social importance of the material is in fact substantially less than its prurient appeal d affirmative defenses 1 nothing in this section shall prohibit any public library or any library operated by an accredited institution of higher education from circulating harmful material to any person under eighteen years of age provided such circulation is in aid of a legitimate scientific or educational purpose and it shall be an affirmative defense in any prosecution for a violation of this section that the act charged was committed in aid of legitimate scientific or educational purposes 2 nothing in this section shall prohibit any parent from distributing to his child any harmful material 3 proof that the defendant demanded was shown and acted in reliance upon any of the following documents as proof of the age of a child shall be a defense to any criminal prosecution under this section a document issued by the federal government or any state county or municipal government or subdivision or agency thereof including but not limited to a motor vehicle operators license a registration certificate issued under the federal selective service act or an identification card issued to a member of the armed forces 4 in the event an advertisement of harmful material as defined in this section culminates in the sale or distribution of such harmful material to a child under circumstances where there was no personal confrontation of the child by the defendant his employees or agents as where the order or request for such harmful material was transmitted by mail telephone or similar means of communication and delivery of such harmful material to the child was by mail freight or similar means of transport it shall be a defense in any prosecution for a violation of this section that the advertisement contained the following statement or a statement substantially similar thereto and that the defendant required the purchaser to certify that he was not under eighteen years of age and that the purchaser falsely stated that he was not under eighteen years of age notice it is unlawful for any person under 18 years of age to purchase the material herein advertised any person under 18 years of age who falsely states that he is not under 18 years of age for the purpose of obtaining the material advertised herein is guilty of a class b misdemeanor under the laws of the state of illinois e child falsifying age it is unlawful for any person under eighteen years of age to falsely state either orally or in writing that he is not under the age of eighteen years or to present or offer to any person any evidence of age and identity which is false or not actually his own for the purpose of ordering obtaining viewing or otherwise procuring or attempting to procure or view any harmful material e part 1986   public indecency a a person who performs any of the following acts in a public place commits the offense of public indecency 1 a lewd exposure of the body done with intent to arouse or satisfy the sexual desire of another  or 2 a lewd fondling or caress of the body of another person of either sex b public place for the purposes of this section means any place where the conduct may reasonably be expected to be viewed by others c for purposes of this section an exposure of the male or female genitals pubic areas or rectal areas or the female breast below a point immediately above the top of the areola shall be prima facie evidence of an intent to arouse or satisfy the sexual desire of another e part 1986   prostitution any person who performs offers or agrees to perform any act of sexual penetration for money commits the offense of prostitution e part 1986   soliciting for a prostitute any person who performs any of the following acts commits the offense of soliciting for a prostitute  a solicits another for the purpose of prostitution  or b arranges or offers to arrange a meeting of persons for the purpose of prostitution  or c directs another to a place knowing such direction is for the purpose of prostitution e part 1986   keeping a place of prostitution any person who has or exercises control over the use of any place which could offer seclusion or shelter for the practice of prostitution who performs any of the following acts commits the offense of keeping a place of prostitution a knowingly grants or permits the use of such place for the purpose of prostitution  or b grants or permits the use of such place under circumstances from which he could reasonably know that the place is used or is to be used for purposes of prostitution  or c permits the continued use of a place after becoming aware of facts or circumstances from which he should reasonably know that the place is being used for purposes of prostitution e part 1986   patronizing a prostitute a any person who performs any of the following acts with a person not his or her spouse commits the offense of patronizing a prostitute 1 engages in an act of sexual penetration with a prostitute  or 2 enters or remains in a place of prostitution with intent to engage in an act of sexual penetration e part 1986 offenses against the public peace and safety   disorderly conduct a person commits the offense of disorderly conduct when he knowingly a does any act in such unreasonable manner as to alarm or disturb another and to provoke a breach of the peace  or b transmits in any manner to the fire department of the village or a fire protection district a false alarm of fire knowing at the time of such transmission that there is no reasonable ground for believing that such fire exists  or c transmits in any manner to another a false alarm to the effect that a bomb or other explosive of any nature is concealed in such place that its explosion would endanger human life knowing at the time of such transmission that there is no reasonable ground for believing that such bomb or explosive is concealed in such place  or d transmits in any manner to any peace officer public officer or public employee a report to the effect that an offense has been committed knowing at the time of such transmission that there is no reasonable ground for believing that such an offense has been committed  or e enters upon the property of another and for a lewd or unlawful purpose deliberately looks into a dwelling on the property window or other opening in it f part 1986   unlawful assembly it shall be unlawful for any person to participate in an unlawful assembly unlawful assembly consists of any of the following a the use of force or violence disturbing authority of law for the purpose of doing violence to the person or property of anyone supposed to have been guilty of a violation of the law or for the purpose of exercising correctional powers or financial hardship or other good cause is shown by the applicant  7162012   1282014  a 8172015 noise   definitions the following terms phrases words and their derivations are defined as follows a ambient noise is the allencompassing noise associated with a given environment being usually a composite of sounds from many sources near and far b a band level is the total sound level of all noise as measured with a sound level meter rising the a weighting network the unit of measurements is the dba c bel is a unit of level when the base of logarithm is ten use of the bel is restricted to levels of quantities proportional to power d decibel is onetenth of a bel and is a unit of level when the base of the logarithm is the tenth root of ten and the quantities concerned are proportional to power e spectrum is a function of time and is a description of its resolution into components each of different frequency and usually of different amplitude and phase and is also used to signify continuous range of components each of different frequency and usually of different amplitude and amplitude and phase and is also used to signify continuous range of components usually wide in extent within which waves have some specified characteristics such as audiofrequency spectrum and is also applied to functions of variables other than time f soundpressure level in decibels of sound is twenty times the logarithm to the base ten of the ratio of the pressure of this sound to the reference pressure which reference pressure must be explicitly stated g bandpressure level of sound for a specified frequency band is the soundpressure level for the sound contained within the restricted band the reference pressure must be specified h cycle is the complete sequence of values of a periodic quantity that occurs during a period i frequency of a function periodic in time is the reciprocal of the primitive period the unit is the cycle per unittime and must be specified j microbar is a unit of pressure commonly used in acoustics and equal to one dyne per square centimeter k period of a periodic quantity is the smallest increment of time for which the function repeats itself l periodic quantity is an oscillating quantity the values of which recur for equal increments of time m soundlevel meter is an instrument including a microphone an amplifier an output meter and frequency weighting networks for the measurement of noise and sound levels in a specified manner n sound analyzer is a device for measuring the bandpressure level or pressurespectrum level of a sound as a function of frequency o emergency work is work made necessary to restore property to a safe condition following a public calamity or work required to protect persons or property from an imminent exposure to danger p all technical definitions are in accordance with american standard entitled acoustical terminology l part 1986   unnecessary noise prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to make continue or cause to be made or continued any excessive unnecessary or unusually loud noise or any noise which either annoys disturbs injures or endangers the comfort repose health peace or safety of others within the limits of the village l part 1986   unnecessary noise standard the following acts among others are declared to be loud disturbing and unnecessary noises in violation of this but said enumeration shall not be deemed to be exclusive namely a horns signaling devices etc the sounding of any horn or signaling device on any automobile motorcycle or other vehicle on any street or public place of the village except as a danger warning  the creation by means of any such signaling device of any unreasonably loud or harsh sound  and the sounding of any such device for an unnecessary and unreasonable period of time  the use of any signaling device except one operated by hand or electricity  the use of any horn whistle or other device operated by engine exhaust  and the use of any such signaling device when traffic is for any reason held up  b radios phonographs etc the using operating or permitting to be played used or operated any radio receiving set musical instrument phonograph or other machine or device for the producing or reproducing of sound in such manner as to disturb the peace quiet and comfort of the neighboring inhabitants or at any time with louder volume than is necessary for convenient hearing for the person or persons who are in the room vehicle or chamber in which such machine or device is operated and who are voluntary listeners thereto the operation of any such set instrument phonograph machine or device between the hours of eleven pm and seven am in such a manner as to be plainly audible at a distance of fifty feet from the building structure vehicle or place where it is located shall be prima facie evidence of a violation of this section  c loudspeakers amplifiers for advertising the using operating or permitting to be together without authority of law  or 2 any natural disaster or manmade calamity including flood conflagration cyclone tornado earthquake or explosion within the corporate limits of the village of wheeling resulting in the death or injury of persons or the destruction of property to such an extent that extraordinary measures must be taken to protect the public health safety and welfare b curfew is hereby defined as a prohibition against any person or persons walking running loitering standing or motoring upon any alley street highway public property or vacant premises within the corporate limits of the village of wheeling excepting officials of any governmental unit and persons officially designated to duty with reference to the civil emergency a part 1968   written declaration whenever an emergency as defined in this exists the president or president pro tem shall declare the existence by means of a written declaration setting forth the facts which constitute the emergency the written declaration shall be set forth in the following form and posted as required by this village of wheeling declaration of state of emergency order whereas  description of hazard and emergency  in  description of area affected by the hazard or emergency   and whereas explanation of ongoing or imminent threat to life or property and how it threatens the health safety and welfare of the residents of the village of wheeling  now therefore it is hereby ordered pursuant to of the municipal wheeling that a state of emergency exists due to  state hazard area affected and potential consequences   it is further ordered that the village of wheeling its officers employees servants agents and appointees are hereby empowered to do all acts and implement all procedures that are considered necessary to prevent or to alleviate the effects of the emergency and which are authorized under the municipal wheeling ordered by the village of wheeling this  date  day of  month  of  year  ___________ president or president pro tem  2006 a part 1968   curfew after proclamation of a civil emergency by the president he may order a general curfew applicable to such geographical areas of the village or to the village as a whole as he deems advisable and applicable during such hours of the day or night as he deems necessary in the interest of the public safety and welfare a part 1968   additional powers after the proclamation of a civil emergency the president of the village of wheeling may also in the interest of public safety and welfare make any or all of the following orders a order the closing of all retail liquor stores including taverns and private clubs or portions thereof wherein the consumption of intoxicating liquor and beer is permitted b order the discontinuance of the sale of alcoholic liquor by any wholesaler or retailer c order the discontinuance of selling distributing or giving away gasoline or other liquid flammable or combustible products in any container other than a gasoline tank properly affixed to a motor vehicle d order the discontinuance of selling distributing dispensing or giving away of any firearms or ammunition of any character whatsoever e issue such other orders as are imminently necessary for the protection of life and property a part 1968   time period for proclamation the proclamation herein authorized shall be effective for a period of fortyeight hours unless sooner terminated by a proclamation of the president indicating that the civil emergency no longer exists the president shall have the power to reproclaim the existence of a civil emergency at the end of each fortyeight hour period during the time the civil emergency exists a part 1968   posting proclamation upon issuing the proclamation herein authorized the chief of police shall notify the news media situated within the village of wheeling and shall cause three copies of the proclamation declaring the existence of the emergency to be posted at the following places within the village of wheeling the village hall the police station and the post office a part 1968   penalty for violation any person violating the provisions of this executive order issued pursuant thereto shall be guilty of an offense against the village of wheeling and shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars a part 1968   limitations nothing contained in this be construed to impair the powers contained in the municipal the village of wheeling giving powers to the police and fire departments but shall be construed together with existing ordinances now in effect for the safety and welfare of the citizens of the village of wheeling a part 1968 shopping carts   definitions as used in this unless the context clearly requires otherwise 1 shopping cart means any wheeled or castered device or equipment a which is designed or used for the holding or transportation of goods or merchandise within or about a business establishment  and b which does not include any mechanical electrical or similar source of power shopping cart includes all such devices and equipment whether or not composed of or designed for use with a basket container or similar receptacle  2 business owner means any person corporation partnership trust or other entity doing business within the village of wheeling which owns or otherwise has the legal right of possession and use of one or more shopping carts and which uses the shopping carts in its business operations including use by its own personnel by its customers or by the general public or sale or rental of shopping carts a part 1981 a part 1976   shopping cartsidentification required a every business owner who makes available the use of shopping carts to its customers or to the public shall identify each shopping cart by permanent marking on the cart or by plate affixed to it such identification shall indicate the name address and telephone number of the business owner the location of the premises at which the shopping cart is used or to be used and shall include a warning in substantially the following form removal of this cart from the premises is prohibited by village ordinance b every shopping cart made available to customers or to the public as of the effective date of the ordinance codified in this be made to bear the permanent marking or plate required by this section within ninety days of the effective date of said ordinance a part 1981 a part 1976   posting of business premises a every business owner who makes available the use of shopping carts to its customers or to the public shall post in a conspicuous location on its premises a notice or notices in accordance with this section a notice shall be plainly visible inside the business premises at each exit from the establishment which is generally available for use by the public however this posting requirement shall not apply to exits from an establishment at which permanently affixed physical barriers are maintained which prevent the passage of the shopping carts provided by the business owner outside of the premises barriers may only be installed subject to any other applicable provisions of village ordinance or law b the notice required by this section shall contain the following language or language substantially as follows removal of any shopping cart from these premises is prohibited by village ordinance violators are subject to fines c exterior notices of the type contemplated by this section shall not be permitted a part 1981 a part 1976   shopping cartsunauthorized removal unlawful it is unlawful for any person to remove any shopping cart from the business premises for which the shopping cart is intended for use as indicated by the required marking or plate without the prior permission of the business owner for the purposes of this section business premises shall include any private parking lot or sidewalk or loading area which is located within or on the property of a private shopping center mall or building but does not include a public street or sidewalk a part 1981 a part 1976   shopping cartsabandonment unlawful it is unlawful for any person to abandon or leave unattended any shopping cart on any public street sidewalk or rightofway or on any private property other than the business premises in connection with which the shopping cart is intended for use as indicated by the required marking or plate a part 1981   shopping carts prohibited from public streets and rightsofway a it is unlawful for any person other than the owner to use in any manner any shopping cart upon any public street sidewalk or rightofway b except for the owner and his agents and employees it is unlawful for any person to be in possession of or to exercise control over any shopping cart outside of the business premises of the business owner provided that it shall be an affirmative defense to a charge of violation of this subsection b that the possession or control is being exercised for the sole purpose of transporting the shopping cart directly to the village authorities or to the business premises identified on the shopping cart or to some other lawful disposal location or for the purpose of removing the cart from a dangerous or obstructing position or location a part 1981   disposition of abandoned and unclaimed shopping carts any shopping cart found upon any public street sidewalk or rightofway in violation of this be removed to a place of storage by the village a unidentified shopping carts any shopping cart removed from any public street sidewalk or rightofway not bearing a permanent marking or plate identifying its owner shall be deemed abandoned and may be immediately disposed of by the village b identified shopping carts for shopping carts bearing the marking or plate required by from any public street sidewalk or rightofway by the village the village shall notify the business owner indicated in the marking or plate of its removal and storage and i there shall be a removal charge of ten dollars payable to the village  and ii there shall be a storage charge of one dollar per day commencing on the tenth day after removal by the village payable to the village any identified shopping cart not claimed and removed by its owner the business owner of the premises in connection with which the shopping cart is intended to be used within thirty days of its removal from a public street sidewalk or rightofway by the village shall be deemed abandoned and may be disposed of by the village such disposition shall not relieve the responsible parties from any liability under this otherwise any amount received by the village however shall be credited against any removal or storage charges outstanding a part 1981   penalty for violation any person firm or corporation violating any provision of this be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as provided in of this code a part 1981 cannabis and other intoxicating compounds   possession of cannabis it shall be unlawful for any person to grow possess sell give away deliver exchange or distribute any cannabis in an amount not to exceed thirty grams m part 1986   use of intoxicating compounds no person shall breathe inhale or drink any compound liquid or chemical containing toluol hexane trichloroethylene acetone toulene ethyl acetate methyl ethyl ketone trichloroathane isopropanol methyl isobutyl ketone methyl cellosolve acetate cyclohexanone or any other substance for the purpose of inducing a condition of intoxication stupefaction depression giddiness paralysis or irrational behavior or in any manner changing distorting or disturbing the auditory visual or mental processes for the purposes of this section any such condition so induced shall be deemed to be an intoxicated condition m part 1986   sale of intoxicating compounds no person shall knowingly sell or offer for sale deliver or give to any person under seventeen years of age unless upon written order of such persons parent or guardian any compound liquid or chemical containing toluol hexane trichloroethylene acetone toluene ethyl acetate methyl ethyl ketone trichloroathane isopropanol methyl isobutyl ketone methyl cellosolve acetate cyclohexanone or any other substance which will induce an intoxicated condition as defined herein when the seller offeror or deliverer knows or has reason to know that such compound is intended for use to induce such condition m part 1986   prescription for intoxicating compounds shall not apply to any person who commits any act described therein pursuant to the direction or prescription of a practitioner authorized to so direct or prescribe for purposes of this section practitioner shall mean any person authorized by law to practice medicine in all its branches in this state to practice dentistry in this state to practice veterinary medicine in this state or to practice chiropody in this state m part 1986   violation and penalties every person found guilty of an offense under shall be subject to either or both of the following penalties a a fine not in excess of five hundred dollars b 1 the court may without entering a judgment of guilty place such person under court supervision for any period not exceeding one year such supervision may include any of the conditions provided for in subsection b2 of this section as the court determines appropriate if the person completes the period of supervision without violating the conditions imposed by the court the court shall discharge the defendant from supervision and dismiss the charge against him if the person while under court supervision is convicted of any criminal offense in any jurisdiction and the states attorney or municipal prosecutor as the case may be moves for termination of supervision the court shall terminate the supervision and enter a judgment of guilty on the plea or finding 2 the conditions of court supervision may in addition require that the defendant a work or pursue a course of study or vocational training  b undergo medical or psychiatric treatment or treatment for drug addiction  and c if a minor to reside with his parent or in a foster home attend school attend a nonresidential program for youth or contribute to his own support at home or in a foster home  d make a report to and appear in person with any social agencies the court may deem appropriate e any other conditions the court feels meets the end of justice 3 when the petition is filed charging a violation of a condition imposed for court supervision the court  a may order a summons to the offender to appear or order a warrant for the offenders arrest where there is danger of his fleeing the jurisdiction or causing serious harm to others or when the offender fails to answer a summons the issuance of such warrant or summons shall stay the sentence of court supervision until the final determination of the charge and the term of court supervision shall not run so long as the offender has not answered the summons or warrant  b shall conduct a hearing of the alleged violation the court may admit the offender to bail pending the hearing  c shall receive evidence in open court with the right of confrontation crossexamination and representation by counsel the village has the burden of going forward with the evidence and proving the violation by the preponderance of the evidence  d shall not revoke court supervision for failure to comply with conditions of a sentence which imposes financial obligations upon the offender unless such failure is due to his wilful refusal to pay  4 if a court finds that the offender has violated a condition at any time prior to the expiration or termination of the period it may continue the offender on the existing period with or without modifying or enlarging the conditions or may impose any other penalty that was available at the time of the initial penalty 5 a judgment revoking a sentence of court supervision is a final appealable order m part 1986  11122012   synthetic alternative drugs a definitions for herein 1 alarm business means the business by any individual partnership corporation or other entity of selling leasing maintaining servicing repairing altering replacing moving or installing any alarm system or causing to be sold leased maintained serviced repaired altered replaced moved or installed any alarm system in or on any building structure or facility 2 alarm system means an alarm system is any device installed for the purpose of alerting others to an unauthorized entry on the premises the commission of an unlawful act or a fire emergency the term alarm system shall include the terms automatic holdup alarm system burglar alarm system and holdup alarm system the term alarm system also includes a receiving station alarm having a direct burglar or fire alarm connection from any building place or premises within the village at the police department or the fire department or a central station alarm system which relays the signal to a private person or company either within or without the corporate boundaries of the village providing watchmen or security service or providing a service to contact the police department or fire department or other emergency personnel of the village of wheeling 3 alarm user means any person family household firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind in control of premises where an alarm system is maintained 4 alarm user permit means a license issued by the village of wheeling for the privilege and ability to operate an alarm system on or in any building structure or facility located within the limits of the village of wheeling 5 automatic telephone alarm means any telephone device or telephone attachment which automatically relays a prerecorded message to report a robbery burglary fire or other emergency situation by means of a telephone line which terminates upon a central switchboard 6 false alarm means any alarm signal eliciting a response by the police andor fire departments wherein an emergency situation does not in fact exist but does not include an alarm activated by violent conditions of nature severe weather power outages or other extraordinary circumstances not reasonably subject to control by the alarm business operator or alarm user a part 1991   alarm user permitrequirementsapplicationfee a user permit required it shall be unlawful for any person firm or corporation to lease use own an alarm systems or be in control of premises where an alarm system is operated or maintained without first having obtained a user permit from the director of finance b fee the annual fee for an alarm user permit shall be as provided in the schedule of fees and charges set forth in of this code per each type of alarm system fire or police for initial permit applications received after october 31st the fee shall be as provided in the schedule of fees and charges set forth in of this code for the remainder of the permit year all fees for alarm user permits shall be paid at the time application is made to the director of finance alarm system permits are nontransferable and government agencies shall be exempt from the alarm user permit fee c application for user permit the application for an alarm user permit shall be filed with the director of finance and shall contain the following information 1 name and address of the applicant 2 name and address of the premises where the alarm systems isare located 3 a statement listing the names addresses and telephone numbers of at least three persons responsible for the premises where the alarm systems isare located and who may be contacted to deactivate the alarm systems 4 the name address and telephone number of the person firm or corporation which installed the alarm systems and of the person firm or corporation responsible for the ongoing maintenance and repair of the alarm systems 5 any additional information which the chief of police the fire chief or the director of finance shall reasonably determine is necessary to properly investigate an application for an alarm user permit to verify that the alarm systems will be installed and operated in compliance with the provisions of this d issuance of alarm user permit the director of finance of the village of wheeling shall issue a permit for alarm users within thirty days after a completed application is filed each permit shall bear the signature of the village president and the director of finance prior to the issuance of such permit the chief of police andor the fire chief may cause such inspection of the applicants premises and individual alarm systems as is deemed necessary e termination of alarm user permit all alarm user permits shall terminate on april 30th of each year the director of finance shall mail to all alarm users of the village a renewal application at least three weeks prior to the date of such expiration  provided that a failure to send out such notice or the failure of the alarm user to receive it shall not excuse the alarm user from a failure to obtain a new permit or a renewal thereof nor shall it be a defense in an action for operation without a permit in the event an alarm user who has had a permit the previous year fails to obtain a permit before may 1st of any year the alarm user shall pay to the director of finance prior to the time the current permit shall be issued the sum of ten dollars as a late charge in the event an alarm user who had a permit the previous year fails to obtain a permit before june 1st of any year the alarm user shall pay to the director of finance prior to the time the current license is issued the sum of twenty dollars as a late charge and thereafter collection procedures shall be instituted f updating alarm system application it shall be unlawful for any alarm system permit holder to fail or refuse to amend its alarm system permit application within ten days after any of the information required and contained therein becomes outdated and inaccurate g alarm system posting requirements no alarm systems shall be installed or maintained unless the permit holder of such alarm systems shall post or cause to be posted at or near the location where such alarm systems can be deactivated a notice containing the name address and telephone number of the person firm or corporation responsible for the maintenance and repairs of such alarm systems h general user permit requirements no alarm system or alarm user permit shall be issued for any alarm system which does not meet the following requirements 1 every burglar alarm system shall be equipped with an alarm delay mechanism that allows for at least a fifteen second delay before activation of the alarm 2 no alarm system shall be cross connected with both burglar alarms and fire alarms on the same line  provided however that alarm systems so installed as of  shall be allowed to remain on a single line until such time as the alarm system is replaced or substantially altered at which time it must be brought in to compliance with this requirement 3 all fire alarm systems shall be installed in accordance with the most current edition of national fire protection notified in the event of activation a part 1991   burglar alarm system deactivation requirements all owners of burglar alarm systems will be responsible for making arrangements to ensure that the property owners regardless of arrangements made it shall be unlawful for any permit holder to cause or permit a burglar alarm system for which a permit has been issued pursuant to this sound in excess of one hour a part 1991   fire alarm system access requirements all owners of fire alarm systems excluding detached singlefamily dwellings shall be responsible to provide a high security supervised exterior of the building must be approved by the fire department prior to installation a part 1991   inspection of alarm systems and business for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of this the dispensing organizations within the village will require the village to perform additional police protection services to prevent and respond to potential impacts on the public health safety and welfare including without limitation determining whether such organizations are being lawfully operated and whether qualifying patients and registered caregivers are complying with applicable laws which prohibit among other offenses a unlawful consumption of medical cannabis  b operation of certain vehicles under the influence of medical cannabis  c disorderly conduct  and d violations of state law and municipal ordinances these additional police protection services will cause the village to incur increased costs in the approximate amount of twenty thousand dollars per year per medical cannabis dispensing organization located within the village which amount is specifically and uniquely attributable to each medical cannabis dispensing organization  12152014   impact fee imposed the village hereby imposes an annual medical cannabis dispensing organization impact fee in the amount of twenty thousand dollars on each medical cannabis dispensing organization located within the village this medical cannabis dispensing organization impact fee shall be paid each year by each medical cannabis dispensing organization located within the village prior to the issuance by the village of a business license for the medical cannabis dispensing organization pursuant to of title 4 of the village code no business license for any medical cannabis dispensing organization will be issued by the village prior to payment of the applicable medical cannabis organization impact fee  12152014   use of impact fee all medical cannabis dispensing organization impact fees collected by the village will be deposited into the police department fund and will be used for the purpose of defraying the cost of providing and performing police protection service attributable to the operation of medical cannabis dispensing organizations within the village  12152014   review of impact fee every few years after  being the effective date of this the village manager and the chief of police will review the cost of the police protection services provided and performed by the village that are attributable to the operation of medical cannabis dispensing organizations within the village to ensure the impact fees are consistent with the cost of services and may recommend any adjustment to the amount of the medical cannabis dispensing organization impact fee imposed by of the village code nondivisible a vehicle and load will be considered nondivisible when further separating or dismantling the vehicle or load 1 would require more than eight work hours to dismantle using appropriate equipment the applicant has the burden of proof as to the number of work hours required to dismantle the load 2 will compromise or destroy the intended use of the load only a load can be either permanently mounted or temporarily secured equipment any parts fluids or material necessary to the operation of only the power unit portion of the vehicle shall be deemed nondivisible 3 would prohibit the vehicle from hauling one attachment that is necessary to the operation of the load to be considered nondivisible the attachment must be securely mounted to the load in the manner it is to be used and not carried as a separate object on the hauling vehicle it is the duty of the applicant to declare such an attachment in the permit application oneway or single trip permit one move from the point of origin to the point of destination any additional stops between the point of origin and the point of destination are expressly prohibited single trip permits are valid for five consecutive days from the date of issuance unless otherwise directed by the police department permit route the route authorized by the issuing authority with proper jurisdiction over the roadways for which permission has been granted to move a vehicle or combination of vehicles that is in itself indivisible or carrying an indivisible load that exceeds normal dimensions or weight or a combination thereof quarterly permit a permit issued to a single truck trucktractor power unit or piece of special mobile equipment which is valid for unlimited moves for a period not to exceed ninety days from the date of issuance roundtrip movement two trips over the same route in opposite directions roundtrip permits are valid for ten consecutive days from the date of issuance semitrailer every vehicle without motive 4252011   immobilization of vehicles for traffic violation judgments a a motor vehicle parked upon a public street public parking lot or private parking lot regulated pursuant to contract at any time may by or under the direction of an officer or member of the wheeling police department be immobilized in such a manner as to prevent its operation if there is outstanding one or more judgments issued in favor of the village of wheeling against the owner of such motor vehicle b upon immobilization of such motor vehicle the officer or employee shall cause to be placed on such vehicle in a conspicuous manner notice sufficient to warn any individual that such vehicle has been immobilized and that any attempt to move such vehicle might result in damage to such vehicle as soon as practicable the officer or employee shall inform the owner of the immobilized vehicle of the nature and circumstances of the prior outstanding traffic violation judgment for which such vehicle was immobilized c the owner of such immobilized vehicle or other authorized person shall be permitted to secure release of the vehicle upon payment of the amount of the fine or penalty for each violation for which there is an outstanding judgment plus statutory interest and the payment of the fees required by subsection f of this section d the owner of the immobilized vehicle or other authorized person shall have the right to a postimmobilization hearing to determine the validity of such immobilization towing and any towing or storage charges such hearing must be requested within seven days after the vehicle is immobilized the postimmobilization hearing shall not be determinative of or adjudicate any judgment issued relative to any immobilized vehicle e the immobilizing device or mechanism shall remain in place for seventytwo hours unless the owner has complied with subsection c of this section if compliance has not occurred within seventytwo hours the vehicle shall be towed or impounded the villages current towing and storage fees shall be paid along with fees specified in subsection f of this section before the owner of such vehicle or authorized person shall be permitted to repossess or secure the release of the vehicle f the owner of an immobilized vehicle shall pay a fee as provided in the schedule of fees and charges set forth in of this code for such immobilization the owner of an immobilized vehicle which was subsequently impounded shall pay a fee as provided in the schedule of fees and charges set forth in of this code for immobilization plus the towing and storage charges actually incurred in such case g it is unlawful for any unauthorized person or persons to attempt to remove or to remove the vehicle immobilizing device h nothing in this section shall be construed to deprive any person of the constitutional right to a hearing or trial as to the violations charged or to an appeal from the judgment entered n 2006  a 1994   reporting excessive stopping standing and parking violations a the village shall send a certified report to the illinois secretary of state against the registered owner of any vehicle that has accumulated ten or more unsatisfied stopping standing and parking violations in this violation under this be considered unsatisfied if the village has previously and properly cited a penalty to the registered owner see this prima facie evidence according to the applicable provisions of the village code and said penalty has remained unpaid or remains outstanding for more than thirty days b the certified report to the secretary of state shall contain the following information 1 the name last known address and drivers license number of the person who failed to pay the fine or penalty and the registration number of any vehicle known to be registered to such person in illinois  2 the name of the municipality making the report  3 a statement that the village has sent a notice of impending drivers license suspension to the address recorded with the illinois secretary of state  4 the date on which the notice was sent  and 5 the address to which the notice was sent c before sending notice to the secretary of state the village shall provide notice to the registered owner of the vehicle the notice sent by the village to the vehicles registered owner shall be sent by first class united states mail postage prepaid to the address of the vehicles registered owner as recorded with the illinois secretary of state and shall set forth the following 1 a statement that the vehicle has ten or more unsatisfied parking or standing violations as set forth in this   2 a statement that failure to pay any fine or penalty within fortyfive days of the notice shall result in the village sending certification to the illinois secretary of state as described in subsection a of this section  3 a statement that failure to pay any fine or penalty within fortyfive days of the notice may result in a suspension of the registered owners illinois drivers license by the illinois secretary of state pursuant to of the illinois vehicle 625 ilcs 563065  and 4 a statement that the registered owner may challenge the accuracy of the certified report by requesting in writing within ten days of receipt of notice a hearing with the village manager or his designee the only bases for such a challenge are i the person not having been the owner or lessee of the vehicle or vehicles receiving ten or more standing parking or compliance violation notices on the date or date such notices were issued  and ii the person having already paid the fine or penalty for the ten or more violations indicated in the certified report  2004 schedule adesignation of yield intersections   schedule adesignated schedule a lessees right to request an administrative hearing to be conducted under this section d administrative hearing within ten business days after a vehicle is seized and impounded pursuant to this section the village shall notify the owner of record or lessee and any lien holder by first class us mail or personal service to the addresses registered with the secretary of state of the owners lessees and any lien holders right to request a hearing to challenge whether a violation of this section has occurred the owner of record lessee or any lien holder seeking a hearing must file a written request for a hearing with the chief of police or his designee no later than ten business days after notice was mailed if a request for a hearing is filed the city shall notify by first class mail or personal service the owner of record or lessee and any lien holder of the date time and location of the administrative hearing the hearing date must be no more than fifteen business days after a request for a hearing has been filed all interested persons shall be given a reasonable opportunity to be heard at the hearing the formal rules of evidence shall not apply at the hearing and hearsay evidence shall be admissible if after the hearing the hearing officer determines by a preponderance of evidence that the vehicle was used in violation of this section then the hearing officer shall enter an order finding the owner of record or lessee of the vehicle civilly liable to the village for the administrative penalty of five hundred dollars if after a hearing the hearing officer does not determine by a preponderance of the evidence that the vehicle was used in such a violation the hearing officer shall enter an order finding for the owner or lessee and for the return of the vehicle if the owner of record or lessee requests a hearing but fails to appear at the hearing or fails to request a hearing in a timely manner the owner of record or lessee shall be deemed to have waived his or her right to a hearing and the hearing officer shall enter a default order in favor of the village in the amount of the administrative penalty however if the owner of record or lessee pays such penalty and the vehicle is returned to the owner or lessee no default order need be entered if the owner or lessee is informed of his or her right to a hearing and signs a written waiver in which case an order of liability shall be deemed to have been made when the village receives the written waiver all orders entered by the hearing officer shall be in writing e disposition of impounded vehicle a penalty imposed pursuant to this section shall constitute a debt due and owing the village a vehicle impounded pursuant to this section shall remain impounded until 1 the penalty of five hundred dollars is paid to the village and all applicable towing fees are paid to the towing agent in which case the person who paid the penalty shall be given possession of the vehicle 2 a bond in the amount of five hundred dollars is posted with the police department and all applicable towing fees are paid to the towing agent at which time the vehicle will be released to the person who posted the bond or 3 the vehicle is deemed abandoned or unclaimed as provided in subsection g below in which case the vehicle shall be disposed of in the manner provided by law for the disposition of abandoned vehicles f owner or lessee of the vehicle shall still be liable to the towing agent for any applicable towing fees if a five hundred dollar penalty is imposed for violation of this section the five hundred dollar bond will be forfeited to the village  however if a violation of this section is not proven by a preponderance of the evidence the five hundred dollar bond will be returned to the person decision g vehicle possession any motor vehicle that is not reclaimed within thirtyfive days after the expiration of the time during which the owner of record or lessee may seek judicial review of the 7162012   tow rotation list a pursuant to 625 ilcs 542035 the chief of police shall be authorized to establish a tow rotation list in the village the chief of police shall create an application to be placed on the tow rotation list and include the requirements for all potential towing vendors which contain at minimum the requirements of 625 ilcs 542035 the chief of police shall evaluate the applications on an annual basis and determine whether the applicants are qualified and whether any changes should be made to the tow rotation list the chief of police may choose to have only one towing service on its tow rotation list complaints regarding the process for inclusion on a tow rotation list or the use of a tow rotation list may be referred in writing to the chief of police the chief of police shall make the final determination as to which qualified towing services shall be included on a tow rotation list b use of tow rotation list whenever a wheeling police officer initiates a tow of a vehicle the officer shall contact the wheeling police dispatch and indicate that a tow has been authorized if more than one towing service is on the tow rotation list the police department shall then select a towing service from tow rotation list corresponding to the geographical area where the tow was authorized and shall contact that towing service directly by phone computer or similar means towing services shall be contacted in the order listed on the appropriate tow rotation list at which point the towing service shall be placed at the end of that tow rotation list in the event a listed towing service is not available the next listed towing service on that tow rotation list shall be contacted c deviations 1 the wheeling police department may decide to deviate from the list if the next towing service is incapable or not properly qualified to handle a specific task or does not have the specific equipment or in the event of an emergency a deviation from the tow rotation order for this reason shall not cause a loss of rotation turn by the towing service determined to be incapable or not properly equipped for handling the request 2 in the event of an emergency the wheeling police department taking into account the safety and location of the situation may deviate from the order of the tow rotation list and obtain towing service from any source deemed appropriate d in addition if the owner or operator of a disabled vehicle is not under arrest and does not abandon his vehicle and the vehicle is not impeding or obstructing traffic illegally parked or poses a security or safety risk as determined by the officer the officer shall allow the owner to select a towing service if the owner chooses not to specify a towing service the law enforcement agency shall select a towing service for the vehicle as provided in subsection b of this section e if a tow operator is present or arrives where a tow is needed and has not been requested by the agency it shall be instructed to leave by law enforcement b 12212015 ordinance enforcement through administrative adjudication of vehicular regulation and automated traffic law enforcement of administrative adjudication authorized by state law and adopted by the village  12132010   village to conduct statistical analysis of automated traffic law enforcement system after installation the village shall conduct a statistical analysis to assess the safety impact of each automated traffic law enforcement system 1 in each school district using school buses equipped with an automated traffic enforcement system following the installation of the system  and 2 at an intersection following installation of the system the statistical analysis shall be based upon the best available crash traffic and other data and shall cover a period of time before and after installation of the system sufficient to provide a statistically valid comparison of safety impact the statistical analysis shall be consistent with professional judgment and acceptable industry practice the statistical analysis also shall be consistent with the data required for valid comparisons of before and after conditions and shall be conducted within a reasonable period following the installation of the automated traffic law enforcement system the statistical analysis required by this subsection shall be made available to the public and shall be published on the website of the village if the statistical analysis for the thirtysixmonth period following installation of the system indicates that there has been an increase in the rate of accidents at either 1 the approach to school buses monitored by the system  or 2 the approach to the intersection monitored by the system the village shall undertake additional studies to determine the cause and severity of the accidents and may take any action that it determines is necessary or appropriate to reduce the number or severity of the accidents at that intersection or involving school buses as the case may be  12132010   12162013 title 11  rightsofway streets and sidewalks chapters construction repair and excavations director of construction or repair required it shall be unlawful to construct install repair replace improve maintain or alter any pavement private or public without having first secured a permit from the engineering department applications for such permits shall be made to the engineering department prior to beginning any such work and shall clearly show the proposed improvements as intended or the extent of repair thereof including the estimated cost of construction as well as the person or firm performing the actual construction work simple maintenance activities such as crack filling and seal coating do not require a permit a part 2004   bond each applicant shall file a bond in the amount of one thousand dollars with surety to be approved by the village engineer conditioned to indemnify the village from any loss or damage resulting from the work undertaken or manner of doing the same a part 2004   specifications all private and public streets driveway approaches and sidewalk pavement shall be installed and constructed in compliance with village specifications a part 2004   repairs required all private and public street alley and sidewalk pavement shall be in good repair such repair work whether performed by the village contractor or the property owner or representative shall meet with the standard requirements and approval of the engineering department a part 2004   defects it shall be the duty of every village official becoming cognizant of any defect in any paved area such as a street alley or sidewalk or an obstruction thereof to report the same to the director of public works as soon as possible a part 2004   barricades required a any person firm or corporation installing or repairing any pavement on a street sidewalk or other public place or making an excavation in the same shall maintain suitable barricades to prevent injury or damage of any person or vehicle by reason of the work such barricades shall be protected by a light at nighttime b any defect in any such pavement shall be barricaded to prevent injury  and any person firm or corporation properly maintaining any opening or excavation in any such place shall guard such opening or excavation while the same remains open by proper barricades and lights a part 2004   disturbing barricades it is unlawful to disturb or interfere with any barricade or lights lawfully placed to protect or mark any new pavement or excavation opening or obstruction in any public street alley or sidewalk a part 2004   excavations a it shall be unlawful to make any excavation within open cut tunnel under or auger any private drive public street alley sidewalk paved area or other public place in the village without having first secured a permit b applications for such permits shall be made to the director of engineering and shall specify the intended location and purposes of the excavation c any person making any such excavation shall backfill the same properly restoring the surface to its original condition all work shall be made subject to the supervision and direction of the director of engineering d open cutting of streets shall be permitted only where and to the extent that tunneling or augering is not practical in the determination of the director of engineering the applicant shall have the burden of proof as to such impracticality and shall submit his request for permission to open cut together with supporting documentation as part of the application required hereunder whenever open cuts or excavations of pavement are made restoration shall be made in accordance with village requirements and practices a part 2004   driveways sidewalks and patios a except as stated in subsection b3 of this section it shall be unlawful to construct install repair replace improve maintain or alter any ingressegress driveway pavement sidewalk and patio private or public in the village without having first obtained a permit from the engineering department all such work requires that a permit be obtained applications for such permits shall clearly show the size location material and cost of the proposed work  and where upon it shall be unlawful to depart from such approved plans and specifications or vary from them without permission of the engineering department a fee as provided in the schedule of fees and charges set forth in of this code shall be paid for such permit b it shall be the responsibility and obligation of the owner of any property on which an existing driveway is constructed or installed and such work is proposed to 1 maintain such pavement in good condition and repair and to keep such driveway free from ice and snow and from any other obstructions where it crosses or abuts any sidewalk  2 maintain the driveway apron in good condition and repair for the purposes of this section driveway apron means the portion of a driveway between the sidewalk and the edge of the street  and 3 perform maintenance activities such as crack filling and seal coating which do not constitute an improvement to the property and are therefore exempt from any permit andor permit fee o 2006  a 2005 a part 2004   penalty for violation any person walk upon or drive any vehicle or animal upon or injure or damage any newly placed street or sidewalk or alley pavement while the same is guarded by a warning sign or barricade  or to knowingly injure build construct place or maintain any building or structure which encroaches upon any public street rightofway or public property except as may be specifically authorized by law or by the director of engineering a part 2004   drains it is unlawful to obstruct any drain whether ownership is public or private a part 2004   poles and wires it is unlawful to erect construct or place any poles or wires or maintain poles or wires over or under any public street or other public way without first securing permission from the village a part 2004   games it shall be unlawful to play any games upon any street alley or sidewalk or other public place where such games cause unnecessary noise or interfere with traffic or pedestrians a part 2004   excavations and scaffolding it is unlawful to construct or maintain any excavation scaffold ladder or temporary obstruction in any public street sidewalk alley rightofway or other public place without first securing permission from the village all permitted excavation or temporary obstructions shall be guarded by barricades an appropriate or suitably strong cover or railing a part 2004   mailboxes it is unlawful to erect build construct place or maintain any type of permanent nonbreakaway support structure as part of or to house a roadside type mailbox within a singlefamily residential district this shall also apply to receptacles such as those used for newspapers which are commonly mounted with or next to the mailbox all mailbox support systems shall be in accordance with the village of wheeling standard entitled mailbox support and 2004  10172011 construction of utility facilities in the rightsofway purpose and scope a purpose the purpose of this to establish policies and procedures for constructing facilities on rightsofway within the villages jurisdiction which will provide public benefit consistent with the preservation of the integrity safe usage and visual qualities of the village rightsofway and the village as a whole b intent in enacting this the village intends to exercise its authority over the rightsofway in the village and in particular the use of the public ways and property by utilities by establishing uniform standards to address issues presented by utility facilities including without limitation 1 prevent interference with the use of streets sidewalks alleys parkways and other public ways and places  2 prevent the creation of visual and physical obstructions and other conditions that are hazardous to vehicular and pedestrian traffic  3 prevent interference with the facilities and operations of the villages utilities and of other utilities lawfully located in rightsofway or public property  4 protect against environmental damage including damage to trees from the installation of utility facilities  5 protect against increased stormwater runoff due to structures and materials that increase impermeable surfaces  6 preserve the character of the neighborhoods in which facilities are installed  7 preserve open space particularly the treelined parkways that characterize the villages residential neighborhoods  8 prevent visual blight from the proliferation of facilities in the rightsofway  and 9 assure the continued safe use and enjoyment of private properties adjacent to utility facilities locations c facilities subject to this to all facilities on over above along upon under across or within the rightsofway within the jurisdiction of the village a facility lawfully established prior to the effective date of this continue to be maintained repaired and operated by the utility as presently constructed and located except as may be otherwise provided in any applicable franchise license or similar agreement d franchises licenses or similar agreements the village in its discretion and as limited by law may require utilities to enter into a franchise license or similar agreement for the privilege of locating their facilities on over above along upon under across or within the village rightsofway utilities that are not required by law to enter into such an agreement may request that the village enter into such an agreement in such an agreement the village may provide for terms and conditions inconsistent with this e effect of franchises licenses or similar agreements 1 utilities other than telecommunications providers in the event that a utility other than a telecommunications provider has a franchise license or similar agreement with the village such franchise license or similar agreement shall govern and control during the term of such agreement and any lawful renewal or extension thereof 2 telecommunications providers in the event of any conflict with or inconsistency between the provisions of this the provisions of any franchise license or similar agreement between the village and any telecommunications provider the provisions of such franchise license or similar agreement shall govern and control during the term of such agreement and any lawful renewal or extension thereof f conflicts with other chapters this all chapters or parts of chapters adopted prior hereto that are in conflict herewith to the extent of such conflict g conflicts with state and federal laws in the event that applicable federal or state laws or regulations conflict with the requirements of this the utility shall comply with the requirements of this the maximum extent possible without violating federal or state laws or regulations h sound engineering judgment the village shall use sound engineering judgment when administering this may vary the standards conditions and requirements expressed in this the village so determines nothing herein shall be construed to limit the ability of the village to regulate its rightsofway for the protection of the public health safety and welfare  part 2007   definitions as used in this unless the context clearly requires otherwise the words and terms listed shall have the a property right or grant authority to the permittee to impinge upon the rights of others who may have an interest in the rightsofway b duration no permit issued under this be valid for a period longer than six months unless construction is actually begun within that period and is thereafter diligently pursued to completion c preconstruction meeting required no construction shall begin preconstruction meeting shall be held at a date time and place designated by the village with such village representatives in attendance as the village deems necessary the meeting shall be for the purpose of reviewing the work under the permit and reviewing special considerations necessary in the areas where work will occur including without limitation presence or absence of other utility facilities in the area and their locations procedures to avoid disruption of other utilities use of rightsofway by the public during construction and access and egress by adjacent property owners d
