requirements and general design standards   conformance generally in laying out a subdivision the subdivider shall conform to 1 the zoning ordinance and all other applicable ordinances of the village of wheeling including floodplain regulations  2 the official plan and map including sector plans if any as amended of the village of wheeling  3 applicable laws rules and regulations of the state of illinois and cook andor lake county and duly constituted agencies thereof  4 in all instances where a requirement of this title is similar to or in conflict with other provisions of the village ordinances county ordinances rules or regulations the most restrictive shall apply and prevail part 2005   streets generally a providing public streets shall be provided for convenient access to all property within the subdivision no private street or thoroughfare shall be permitted except in case of drives in planned developments where maintenance is the responsibility of the association or management organization of such development b conformity with official map the street layout of the subdivision shall be in general conformity with the official map for the most advantageous development of adjoining areas in the entire neighborhood the streets shall be designed and located in relation to existing and planned streets to topographical conditions and natural terrain features such as streams and existing tree growth to provide public convenience and safety and in their appropriate relation to the proposed use of the land to be served by such streets c state and county regulations all streets in a subdivision abutting a state or county highway shall meet all the requirements of the state or county regulations pertaining thereto as well as meeting the requirements of this title where such requirements are in conflict the more restrictive shall apply d width and location whenever a tract to be subdivided embraces any part of a public street so designated on the official map such part of such street shall be platted by the subdivision at the location and width indicated on the plan part 2005   street classification major secondary and collector streets as classified in this section shall be as shown and designated on the official map a major street those state county and village designated routes which provide continuity of travel and freedom from hazards and congestion necessary for interregional and village traffic movement b secondary street those routes so designated by the village to be of importance in intravillage traffic movement and necessary to provide easy access to neighboring communities c collector street those primary streets within the neighborhood unit providing a reasonable alignment coupled with an attractive pavement which will act to collect traffic from minor streets for travel to secondary and major streets d minor street those streets whose prime function is to give access to abutting property they are not intended to carry heavy are designed to discourage such movement e marginal access street the minor streets which serve to control access to major thoroughfares and permit development of lands adjacent to high speed and high capacity highways their prime function is property access f drives private roadways within a planned development providing internal access from bordering public streets to buildings and parking areas in the development part 2005   street continuations provision shall be made so that all proposed streets shall have a direct connection with or be continuous and in line with existing planned or platted streets with which they are to connect except in case of planned development where internal drives are a part of overall development plan and where a smooth flow of traffic around the development is possible part 2005   extending streets to boundaries proposed streets shall be extended to the boundary lines of the tract to be subdivided unless prevented by topography or other physical conditions or unless in the opinion of the plan commission such extension is not necessary or desirable for the coordination of the layout of the subdivision with the existing layout or the most advantageous future development of adjacent tracts culdesacs not over four hundred feet in length will be approved when necessitated by topography or other conditions or factors part 2005   street grades the grade of major and secondary streets shall be as required in the official wheeling standards which are made a part of this part 2005   horizontal curves there shall be a minimum centerline radius of six hundred feet for major streets three hundred feet for secondary streets and one hundred fifty feet for all other streets except for drives part 2005   vertical curves vertical curves shall be as required in the official wheeling standards which are made a part of this part 2005   compliance subdivisions shall comply with the zoning ordinance and all other applicable ordinances of the village of wheeling including floodplain regulations and all stormwater management as required within the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this part 2005   street tangents a tangent at least one hundred feet long shall be introduced between reverse curves on major secondary and collector streets part 2005   street names new street names shall not duplicate the names of existing streets but streets that are continuations of others already in existence and named shall bear the name of the existing streets all new streets shall be given a name acceptable to the plan commission and approved by fire and police departments part 2005   culdesac streets streets designed to have one end permanently closed shall not exceed four hundred feet in length and shall terminate in a turnaround a turnaround shall have a rightofway not less than one hundred twenty feet in diameter and a paved roadway turnaround of ninety feet in diameter part 2005   deadend streets deadend streets are prohibited except where a street is to be projected into the adjacent property upon future development part 2005   halfstreets halfstreets shall not be permitted except where they may be necessary to comply with the major or secondary street plan as shown in the official map when a subdivision is adjacent to a previously dedicated halfstreet the other half of the street shall be dedicated by the subdivider part 2005   intersections a jogs street jogs with centerline offsets of less than one hundred twentyfive feet shall not be permitted where streets intersect major streets their alignment shall be continuous  b angles streets shall intersect in a manner to insure safe traffic flow preferably at right angles but in no case shall the centerlines of two streets intersect with an acute angle of less than sixty degrees part 2005   alleys a commercial and industrial districts alleys may be provided in commercial and industrial districts where no other provision is made for service access all loading and parking shall be offstreet and shall be consistent with and adequate for the uses proposed b residential areas alleys shall not be approved in residential areas unless exceptional circumstances prevail c width where alleys are provided they shall conform to the official map but in no case shall they have a rightofway less than thirty feet wide d deadend alleys deadend alleys are prohibited part 2005   streets parallel to rightofways where a subdivision borders on or contains a railroad or limited access highway rightofway the plan commission may require a street approximately parallel to and on each side of such rightofway at a distance suitable for the appropriate use of the intervening land as for park purposes in residential districts or for parking commercial or industrial purposes in appropriate districts such distances shall also be determined with due regard for the requirements of approach grade and possible future grade separations part 2005   reserve strips reserve strips controlling access to streets or underground utilities shall be prohibited except where their control is placed with the village under conditions approved by the plan commission or where they are a part of planned development and control is vested in the management of such development under rules and bylaws submitted with the planned development plans part 2005   public use facilities and areas a stormwater runoff in addition to providing for streets alleys and access ways and easements for public facilities and utilities provision shall be made for the dedication or reservation of such stormwater or floodwater runoff channels and basins park playground school ground and other public grounds as may be reasonably required by the plan commission to conform to the principles set forth in the official map which shall be a part of the comprehensive plan of the village and this title provision shall be made for maintenance in perpetuity for all public facilities either or public ownership b miscellaneous public land in addition to subsection a of this section any public grounds designated on the official map which lie within a proposed subdivision and which have not been otherwise provided for shall be reserved for the particular public use or uses so designated on the official map for a period of twelve months from the date of recording of the final plat or subdivision c designation on plat such dedicated or reserved area shall be designated in the plat of subdivision by the proper words of to be dedicated or reservation designating the public body and its use to which the land is dedicated or reserved part 2005   block and lot layout 1 length and width generally the lengths widths and shapes of blocks shall be such as are appropriate for the locality and the type of development contemplated but block length in residential areas shall not exceed twelve hundred sixty feet nor be less than four hundred feet nor have less than sufficient width to provide for two tiers of lots of appropriate depth between street lines 2 walkways pedestrian walkways not less than ten feet wide may be required by the plan commission center of blocks more than nine hundred feet long where deemed essential to provide circulation or access to schools playgrounds shopping centers transportation andor other community facilities 3 general the following regulations apply a lot dimensions shall conform to the requirements of the appropriate zoning classification of the wheeling zoning ordinance but in no case shall a lot have an average depth of less than one hundred feet  b residential lots which abut upon major streets shall also abut upon a minor street vehicular access to such lots shall be to the minor street only  c the lot shall be of sufficient depth to provide for adequate space to meet the appropriate zoning ordinance requirements for yards offstreet parking and loading but lot depths in residential areas shall not exceed three times their average width  d these provisions are not applicable to planned developments when a harmonious grouping of buildings is the design criteria and when the bulk requirements of the applicable codes are met 4 side lot line angle side lot lines shall be substantially at right angles or radial to street lines 5 boundary lines not cross municipal or county boundary lines 6 double frontage frontage lots shall be prohibited except where necessary to provide separation of residential development from traffic arteries as in subsection 3 of this section whenever lots back up to a major street suitable screen planting shall be provided by the subdivider along the major streets part 2005   easements easements where required shall be provided along a lot line and normally centered upon the lot line evidence shall be furnished the plan commission that easements and any easement provisions to be incorporated on the plat or in deeds have been reviewed by the individual utility companies or the organization responsible for furnishing the service involved where easements will be used for rear or side lot drainage they shall be a minimum of twelve feet wide and normally centered all easements shall also be considered and noted as both utility and drainage easements part 2005   drainage and floodplain provisions 1 study every proposed subdivision shall make provision for adequate surface drainage to prevent flooding the provisions shall be based upon a study prepared by the subdividers engineer of the entire area tributary to streams channels or drainage ways in the subdivision this study upon which design of the storm sewer and drainage system will be based shall consist of at least the following a analysis of area tributaries affecting the subdivision including area topography drainage rainfall intensity and frequency runoff and flooding  b a topographic map of the subdivision indicating any floodplain and floodway areas and the corresponding base flood elevation data as determined in title 22  c a report of the basis of the design of the proposed sewers open channels and controlled flow detention basins proposed for the subdivision 2 streets as channels the proposed drainage system and outlet of the subdivision shall be designed so that it will not fail to function if a base flood should occur streets shall be designed where possible to act as open channels with positive drainage toward the major watercourse or channel in the area 3 rightofway provision for major watercourse each major river drainageway or stream as shown on the most current flood boundary and floodway map including but not limited to the des plaines river mcdonald creek buffalo creek wheeling drainage ditch which borders or traverses the proposed subdivision shall be provided with a stormwater easement or rightofway conforming substantially with the lines of the watercourse and of such further width as will be adequate to accommodate observed computed or anticipated flood flows and heights and will provide access along the channel for operation of channel operation and maintenance equipment in any case the minimum width of such a stream rightofway shall not be less than forty feet on each side of the centerline of such major river drainageway or stream if a major watercourse traverses subdivision the watercourse shall be improved by the subdivider in compliance with plans and specifications on file in the village engineers office the improvements shall be guaranteed by surety as provided in this title 4 rightofway for minor watercourse each minor drainageway channel or watercourse which borders or traverses the proposed subdivision shall be maintained as open channels with a stormwater easement or rightofway of adequate width to accommodate observed computed or anticipated runoff and flood flows in any case the minimum width of these channel rightsofway shall be not less than twenty feet on each side of the centerline of such minor drainageway channel or watercourse upon indication of adequacy of design as evidenced by the studies provided for in subsection 1 of this section the upper reaches of such drainageways may be enclosed as a part of the storm system if a minor watercourse traverses subdivision the watercourse shall be improved by the subdivider in compliance with the approved plans and specifications on file in the village engineers office the improvements shall be guaranteed by surety as provided in this title 5 side lot drainage easements where the drainage plan for a proposed subdivision required rear or side lot drainage easements such easements shall be centered on the lot lines and shall be a minimum of twelve feet in width with the exception of utility poles no structures landscaping except for grass or landfill shall be placed in these drainage easements 6 floodplain regulations all floodplain areas of a subdivision are subject to the regulations of the floodplain ordinance title 22 7 retention basins when a subdivision drainage plan proposes use of retention basins or ponds which are to be dedicated for public use provision shall be made that a public access be possible of a street stub to connect the facility to a public street part 2005   natural features in all subdivisions due regard shall be given to the preservation of natural features streets and easements shall be located where they will not interfere with large trees watercourses or historical or other similar community assets which if preserved would add attractiveness and value to the subdivision and village part 2005   standard requirements relating to parks playgrounds school sites and other public grounds whenever a final plat of subdivision or part thereof is submitted for approval to the corporate authorities it shall have designated thereon the reservation of either a school site park site playground site or other public ground site as indicated on the official map in conformance with the following standard requirements relating to the size of such parks playgrounds school sites and other public grounds 1 elementary school site 10 acres 2 junior high school site 30 acres 3 high school site 40 acres 4 park sites 1 acre per 100 persons utilizing the property 5 playground sites 1 acre per 100 persons utilizing the property 6 public grounds for use by governmental agencies 25 acres the location of these various sites shall be as indicated on the official map the above requirements are minimum standard requirements and may be increased or decreased as the corporate authorities having jurisdiction of such use may determine the corporate authority having jurisdiction of such use be it a school board park board or other authority may waive the reservation of the school park playground or public land site by depositing a written waiver with the wheeling plan commission the sites on the final plat of subdivision shall be marked reserved for school purposes or reserved for park purposes or reserved for playground purposes or reserved for public grounds as the case may be in the body of the plat for subdivision a statement shall be made that the area reserved for  is reserved pursuant to the statute but is not in any way dedicated and that in the event no action is taken within the statutory one year period by the corporate authority reserving the site to acquire the site by purchase or condemnation the reservation shall become void whenever a final plat of subdivision or part thereof has been approved by the corporate authorities as complying with the official map and there is designated therein a school site park site or other public land the corporate authorities having jurisdiction of such use be it a school board park board or other authority such authority shall acquire the land so designated by purchase or commence proceedings to acquire such land by condemnation within one year from the date of approval of such plat  and if it does not do so within such period of one year the land so designated may then be used by the owners thereof in any other manner consistent with this title including the official map and the zoning ordinance of the municipality part 2005   singlestory buildings a plat of approved otherwise by the village engineer c septic tanks a subdivision plat within the village shall in no case be approved which shall be dependent upon individual septic tanks however where there are lots of one acre or more outside the corporate limits but within the official map area individual septic tanks shall be permitted on lots of one acre or more part 2005   design standardsstorm drainage system a required a storm sewer system shall be constructed throughout the development or entire subdivision which shall be separate and independent of the sanitary sewer system and which shall provide an efficient outlet which will not fail to function when the receiving stream is in full flood all developments shall provide an adequate stormwater drainage system which will convey runoff to the system outfall provisions within the plans for controlling all erosion and sedimentation are to be shown where necessary applicable and required such as for stormwater discharges into open waterways ie rivers creeks ditches etc an approved debris collectionseparation device shall be installed compliance with all permitting agencies shall be met particularly those of the national pollution discharge elimination system npdes phase ii regulations b standards no street shall be constructed unless provisions are made for the concurrent installation and construction of storm sewers the installation construction and design of the storm sewers herein required shall be in accordance with stormwater facilities of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this part 2005   design standardswater supply and distribution system a mains water mains shall be installed in such a manner that every lot parcel of land or building to be serviced thereby shall be serviced by means of a separate service connection within its own frontage and shall be so connected to the existing water distribution system as to be circulating all water mains shall be looped fire suppression and protection services where necessary shall be accommodated in a single combined service this single water service shall be sized to simultaneously supply the domestic needs of the structure as well as the fire suppression system demand the installation construction and design of the mains herein required shall be in accordance with water distribution system of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this b hydrants fire hydrants and auxiliary valves in general shall be installed and located at intervals of approximately three hundred feet in a manner permitting connection of a ten foot to twenty foot nonflexible streamer hose connection with a fire truck parked on the pavement the installation construction and design of the hydrants herein required shall be in accordance with water distribution system of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this c appurtenances other necessary appurtenances such as valves valve vaults fittings etc shall be installed where necessary the installation of this part 2005 a 6192017   design standardsservices services for sewers and water shall be constructed to connect with the utility mains constructed within any street rightofway or easement to 2005   wheeling sidewalk construction fund sidewalks will be installed where appropriate and shall be required in all cases however if in the opinion of the village engineer it is impractical to install such a sidewalk or other extenuating circumstances exist then a contribution for such sidewalk shall be made and deposited in the village of wheeling sidewalk construction fund in accordance with the following a the wheeling sidewalk construction fund shall be maintained by the director of finance  b in lieu of the actual construction or installation of any sidewalk required by ordinance the village may require that the cost of constructing or installing such sidewalk be deposited in the wheeling sidewalk construction fund where the plan commission shall make a recommendation to the village board and where determined by the village engineer 1 current and projected pedestrian traffic does not warrant the sidewalk 2 construction or installation of the sidewalk at the time will result in an isolated sidewalk segment 3 the village board feels that it is in the best interest of the village to do so  c sidewalk cost for the purpose of determining required deposits to the wheeling sidewalk fund shall be established by the president and board of trustees by resolution on an annual basis deposit in the wheeling sidewalk fund of an amount approved by the village for any  d the village may utilize funds available from time to time within the wheeling sidewalk fund for the construction or installation of any sidewalks within the village as may be determined to be appropriate by the village at its sole discretion the village shall not be obligated to utilize funds within the wheeling sidewalk fund for any particular project or sidewalk regardless of whether a deposit to the fund has been made in lieu of construction of a particular sidewalk  e all rightofway for required sidewalks shall be dedicated to the village of wheeling the sidewalks themselves shall design standardslandscaping street trees trees and landscaping shall meet the requirements of title 12 trees and vegetation of the village municipal a grading and seeding all street rightsofway other than the area used by walks and pavements shall be graded and sodded  b spacing street trees shall be provided throughout the entire proposed subdivision such trees shall be planted within the street rightofway not less than ten feet unless approved otherwise from the rightofway line and on each side they shall be spaced so that 1 minimum spacing will be forty feet 2 maximum spacing will be eighty feet 3 each lot shall have at least one tree in the street rightofway along its frontage except corner lots which shall have at least two trees one on each side facing the street to be planted at least twentyfive feet from the corner lot line placement of trees in a planned development shall be pursuant to the designation of the plan commission  c species trees shall be of any desirable species which meet the approval of the village board of trustees or such body or commission as may be designated by the village board of trustees for this purpose and the subdivider shall furnish trees that are guaranteed for growth for a period of one year from planting and certified free from disease under the state of illinois plant inspection department standards  d prohibiting undesirable trees trees undesirable for parkway shall be prohibited such as trees that have inherent factors which might cause nuisance destruction of sewers pavements or curbs by the growth of roots or the creation of hazards to safety examples of such trees are considered to be poplar willow cottonwood elm box elder silver maple and similar soft wood trees  e screen planting screen and decorative planting as approved shall be provided by the subdivider in all areas where buildings back up to streets live landscaping shall be provided in shopping centers and parking areas as approved by the sections of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this part 2005 stormwater management   detentionretention facilities stormwater management facilities including retention and detention areas as well as associated piping and conveyance shall be designed and constructed in accordance with stormwater facilities of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this management shall be required for all projects part 2005   additional regulations when detention is provided the following regulations shall apply in addition to the regulations of the village and the metropolitan water reclamation district of greater chicago a bypass channel a natural or surface channel system shall be designated with adequate capacity to convey development of the stormwater runoff from all tributary upstream areas further it shall meet the requirements of of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this management shall be required for all projects 1 these bypass channels shall be designed to carry the peak rate of runoff from a onehundredyear storm assuming all storm sewers are blocked and that the upstream areas are fully developed and have been saturated with antecedent rainfall no habitable structures shall be constructed within this overland flow route  however streets and parking or playground areas and utility easements may be considered compatible users 2 the design of this overland flow route system shall also take into consideration control of stormwater velocity to prevent erosion or other damage to a facility which will restrict its primary use depths of flow shall be kept to a minimum and the channel configurations shall be approved by the village engineer 3 if the development should contain an existing natural waterway or flow way this area shall be preserved as part of the bypass drainage system construction of a low flow system of storm sewers to carry the minor storm runoff with a bottom of sufficient width which is adequate to facilitate maintenance and carry the runoff without eroding velocities shall be included in the plans for development b dry basins all pervious dry bottom stormwater storage areas shall be designed to serve a secondary purpose for recreation open space or other types of uses that will not be adversely affected by occasional or intermittent inundation 1 a method of carrying the low flow areas shall be provided in addition to a system of drains and both shall be provided with a positive gravity outlet to a natural channel or storm sewer having adequate capacity 2 flow for detention basins are discouraged and generally not permitted 3 the combination of storage of the water from a onehundredyear storm and the designed release rate shall not result in a storage duration in excess of seventytwo hours maximum depth of planned stormwater storage facility shall not exceed four feet unless the existing natural ground contours and other conditions lend to greater storage depth and such as approved by the village engineer minimum grades for turf areas shall be two percent and maximum slopes shall be ten percent ten units horizontally to one unit vertically storage area side slopes shall be kept as close to the natural land contours as practical and a ten percent slope or less shall be used wherever possible if slopes greater than ten percent are necessary to meet storage requirements or area restrictions the approval shall be obtained from the village engineer and suitable erosion control provided in addition to the protection required to insure public health safety and welfare in no case will side slopes greater than  be permitted 4 outlet control structures shall be designed as simply as possible and shall require little or no attention for proper operation each stormwater storage area shall be provided with a method of emergency overflow in the event that a storm in excess of the onehundredyear frequency storm occurs this emergency overflow facility shall be designed to function without attention and shall become part of the natural or surface channel system described in subsection a of this section hydraulic calculations shall be submitted to substantiate all design features 5 both outlet control structures and emergency overflow facilities shall be designed and constructed to fully protect the public health safety and welfare stormwater runoff velocities shall be kept as a minimum and turbulent conditions at an outfall control structure will not be permitted without complete protection for the public safety the use of restrictive fences shall be kept to a minimum and used only when no other method is feasible c wet basins wet bottom stormwater storage areas shall be designed with all of the items required for dry bottom stormwater storage areas except that a low flow conduit and a system of drains with a positive gravity outlet may be eliminated each such area shall comply with the following conditions 1 water surface area shall not exceed onetenth of the tributary drainage area unless approved otherwise  2 shoreline protection shall be provided to prevent erosion from wave action  3 minimum normal water depth shall be four feet if fish are to be used to keep the pond clean a minimum of onefourth of the pond area shall be a minimum of ten feet deep  4 facilities shall be available if possible to allow the pond level to be lowered by gravity flow for cleaning purposes and shoreline maintenance  5 control structures for stormwater release shall be designed to operate at full capacity with only a minor increase in the water surface level hydraulic calculations shall be submitted to substantiate all design features  6 in the event that the water surface of the pond is to be raised for purposes of storing water for irrigation or in anticipation of the evapotranspiration demands of dry weather the volume remaining for storage of excess stormwater runoff shall still be sufficient to contain the onehundredyear storm runoff  7 aeration facilities to prevent pond stagnation shall be provided design calculations to substantiate the effectiveness of these aeration facilities shall be submitted with the engineering plans d roof and parking lot storage paved surfaces that are to serve as stormwater storage areas shall have minimum grades of one percent rooftop storage will not be allowed if a portion of an area within a stormwater storage area is to be paved for parking or recreational purposes the paved surface shall be placed near the highest elevation within the storage area as possible parking lot grades shall not exceed normal design parameters e flood damage prevention the facilities for stormwater runoff control shall be constructed prior to any earth moving or drainage related construction on the project site f erosion control during the construction phases means methods and facilities shall be provided to prevent the erosion of the earth silting of downstream areas are to be prevented strategic use of silting basins sodding of runoff channels or other such methods in accordance with the soil erosion and sedimentation plan for the project as well as limiting the period of time during which the earth is stripped of vegetation part 2005   watershed development ordinance adopted by reference the lake county watershed development as most recently amended by the county of lake on  is hereby adopted by reference and is in full force and effect within the areas of the village of wheeling located in lake county and is found in its own compilation c 2006  1012012  i 932013  a 1272015 surveying requirements   surveys required every subdivision of land under the terms of this title shall require a survey meeting the requirements specified in this part 2005   monuments all lot corners points of curvature points of tangent etc shall be marked with iron pipes or concrete monuments part 2005   accuracy of survey the survey shall be performed by a surveyor registered in the state of illinois part 2005   restaking upon completion of the construction of structures within the subdivision the subdivider shall have the entire subdivision or any portion thereof he desires to have accepted checked verified and restaked if necessary by a registered licensed illinois land surveyor iron pipe monumentation shall be eighteen inches long and at least threequarters inch in diameter this work shall be performed and certified to by the surveyor part 2005 construction design and installation standards for improvements   generally in all cases the developer or subdivider shall be responsible for having his engineer coordinate supervise stake and inspect all work for satisfactory compliance covered in this part 2005   standards for underground improvements generally 1 outside pavement the underground utilities shall be installed outside the pavement wherever possible the use of public utility easements across the front of lots is encouraged special care shall be taken to insure that services clear other utilities installed in such easement 2 screenings where underground utilities are installed in the roadway under sidewalks or within three feet thereof appropriate backfill material shall be used for backfilling the trenches this shall also apply to work undertaken by the utility companies 3 pipe standards the loading on pipes shall be determined from the appropriate design tables 4 curved alignment sewers may be installed on a curved alignment if approved by the village engineer minimum radius of curved sewers shall be no less than two hundred feet as measured at the centerline of the sewer 5 manholes manholes shall be a minimum of four feet in diameter and designed in accordance with the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this manholes shall be located at no more than four hundred feet intervals manholes shall be built at points where the sizes of the sewer changes where the horizontal or vertical alignment changes at changes in pipe material and at the junction of two or more sewers sanitary sewer manholes shall be of precast concrete construction on curved sewers ten inches in diameter or under having a radius of less than six hundred feet the maximum manhole spacing shall be two hundred fifty feet 6 compliance with metropolitan water reclamation district of greater chicago all sewers shall be installed in accordance with whichever is more restrictive  the manual of practice of the design of public and private improvements and the manual of procedures for the administration of the sewer permit by the metropolitan water reclamation district of greater chicago 7 elevation references all elevations shall be referred to north american vertical datum 1988 navd 88 8 separate sewers separate storm sewers and sanitary sewer systems are required no combined sewer will be permitted part 2005   standards for storm sewers the design and materials shall be in accordance with stormwater facilities of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this 1 computing method the runoff and storm sewer design shall be determined by the rational method the intensity used shall be a return frequency of not less than five years the coefficient c shall be determined by the character of the area to be drained and shall conform to accepted standard engineering practices as found in c runoff coefficient in the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this 2 flood hazards where the downstream capacity of the sewer system is inadequate and the proposed sewers will not handle the runoff or where the topography of the ground is such that flooding can be expected more often than the period for which the system is designed the developers engineer shall point this out in his drainage computations report the possibility of flooding may then be reduced use of a modified grading plan andor possible use of oversized detention basins prior to planning any detention basin the location must be approved by the village engineer 3 catch basins all catch basins shall be a minimum of four feet in diameter and shall have a sump of three and onehalf feet the catch basins shall be spaced to provide sufficient drainage of the tributary area without causing excessive ponding where the quantity of water entering a catch basin may cause the overloading of an existing sewer the outlet pipe from the catch basin may be restricted in its diameter in no case however shall the size of the sewer or grate opening be underdesigned 4 draining rear it is necessary to install drainage structure to drain rear lot areas and other such areas type 8 grate may be permitted 5 material all storm sewers shall be reinforced concrete rcp c76 class shall be as determined by the loading the same shall apply to inlet and catch basin connection pipe 6 minimum size the minimum size storm sewer shall be twelve inches in diameter unless approved otherwise the minimum size connection pipe shall be eight inches 7 inlets inlets may be used but they shall discharge into catch basins and not directly into the storm sewer as outlined in design of inlets and catchbasins of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this part 2005   standards for sanitary sewers design and materials shall be in accordance with sanitary sewer facilities of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this 1 quantity and quality of effluent the quantity and quality of effluent shall be determined in accordance with the standards established by metropolitan water reclamation district of greater chicago mwrdgc as determined with their manual of procedures for the administration of the sewer permit the sewage and waste control latest editions 2 rate of infiltrationexfiltration the allowable rate of infiltrationexfiltration shall not exceed limits established by the metropolitan water reclamation district of greater chicago mwrdgc the village will not accept any sanitary sewer that fails to meet these requirements 3 inspection the village shall check and inspect the sanitary sewers before tentative acceptance for conformance to these standards all sanitary sewers shall be televised at the developers expense with the appropriate tapes and reports submitted to the village engineer prior to tentative acceptance of such sewers any and all noted defects andor deficiencies shall be corrected by and at the developers expense prior to such tentative acceptance 4 footing drains sump pumps and downspouts footing drains sump pumps and downspouts shall not be connected to sanitary sewers and shall be in accordance with stormwater facilities of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this part 2005   standards for water mains design and materials shall be in accordance with water distribution system of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this part 2005   standards for pavement design design and materials shall be in accordance with pavement design of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this 1 width of pavement the width of the pavement shall be in accordance with this title the crown shall vary from four inches to six inches depending on the width of the pavement 2 pavement types a flexible design b rigid design 3 minimum pavement grade the minimum pavement grade shall be fourtenths of one percent 4 maximum grade the maximum grade for major and secondary streets shall be three percent the maximum grade for other streets shall be five percent 5 vertical curves vertical curves shall be used wherever the algebraic difference in grade exceeds one and onehalf percent minimum length to be one hundred feet or as may be required by the village engineer 6 curb return radius a minimum curb return radius of thirty feet shall be used at the intersection of two major or secondary or one major or secondary and one other type street the minimum radius for other streets shall be twenty feet 7 subgrade the subgrade for all pavements shall be in accordance with the standard specifications for road and bridge construction in the state of illinois published by the illinois department of transportation latest edition 8 materials curb and gutter shall be portland cement concrete sixbag mix the village standard for curb and gutter shall be used curb design and materials shall be in accordance with pavement design of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this 9 whenever new curb and gutter is placed abutting existing curb two fiveeighths inch dowel bars must be drilled and set into the existing curb and gutter section 10 sidewalks sidewalks shall be constructed of sixbag mix portland cement concrete and shall be five feet minimum in width and five inches in depth with expansion joints at fiftyfoot intervals and contraction joints at fivefoot intervals sidewalk design and materials shall be in accordance with sidewalks and of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this 11 driveway driveway design and materials shall be in accordance with of the manual of practice for the design of public and private improvements which are made a part of this part 2005   construction and material standards where not otherwise covered herein all work and materials used shall be constructed as provided in bituminous concrete and portland cement concrete shall be mixed and produced under the supervision and control of a competent testing laboratory with daily reports submitted to the village engineer or curing purposes  g the village engineer may require the subdividers engineer or contractor to take a number of test cylinders or beams to be cured and tested in compression by a materials laboratory which will be at no expense to the village the number or samples to be taken and the breaking dates shall be as determined by the village engineer part 2005   construction scheduling a concrete concrete may be placed only during the period from april 1st to november 15th b concrete cold weather concrete placed during cold weather or outside of the time limits stated in subsection a of this section shall meet the requirements of the village of wheeling cold weather construction  concrete policy c bituminous concrete bituminous concrete work may be constructed only during the period from fulltime construction inspection the village shall at the expense of the developer make inspections as it deems necessary throughout the construction period including those improvements that are to be installed internally in a planned development which may be maintained by the management maximum cooperation shall be provided to all village inspectors in the case of a planned development the developers engineer and village will consider all sanitary sewer services and water services as to be privately maintained however due to the problem of infiltration and leakage they shall be subject to the same inspection as if they were to be public all storm sewers shall be inspected as though public prior to priming the subbase the village engineer shall be notified so that he may check for proper thickness crown and curb edge exposure upon completion of the underground improvements sewers watermains drainage appurtenances etc shall be thoroughly inspected and defects noted on a punch list to be provided to the developer correction of the items noted on the punch list shall initiate the tentative acceptance of the work the date of the resolution approved by the village board of trustees shall constitute the date of tentative acceptance of the public improvements tentative acceptance shall not mean that the village accepts the responsibility for maintaining these improvements maintenance from time of tentative acceptance until final acceptance of the improvements shall be the responsibility of the developer or subdivider it may occasionally be necessary to make emergency interim repairs to the underground or surface improvements the village shall notify the developer or subdivider when it becomes necessary to make these repairs and it shall be the developers or subdividers responsibility to see that these repairs are made within twentyfour hours of notification if these repairs are not accomplished during this period the village may make the repairs and charge all costs to the developer or subdivider after the bituminous concrete binder course or bituminous aggregate mixture base course has been installed for a winter followed by a spring it shall be thoroughly inspected by the village the developers engineer and the contractor a punch list shall be made of all defects and as soon as these are corrected the bituminous concrete surface course will be installed the underground improvements will also be reinspected at this time after the bituminous concrete surface course has been installed for twelve months a final inspection shall be made by the village and the developer this inspection will cover all improvements including but not limited to sidewalks pavements sewers watermains street lights buffalo boxes lot grading etc after all improvements meet with the approval of the village engineer he will recommend final acceptance be made part 2005 recapture   definitions as used in this the following terms have the indicated meaning unless the context clearly requires otherwise 1 recapture means the reimbursement of the village or the reimbursement of an owner or developer of real property for a portion of the cost of certain public improvements from fees or amounts charged to owners of other or adjacent properties within the village if and when the owners developers or occupants of such other or adjacent properties tie into or connect to or use such public improvements  2 public improvements mean water mains sanitary sewers storm sewers detention basins retention basins and any public improvement associated with any of the foregoing public improvements which are subject to recapture are limited to those which are or will be dedicated to the village of wheeling part 2005   recapture authorized a whenever an owner or developer of property within the village of wheeling 1 proposes to install or construct any public improvement which will benefit adjacent or other properties within the village or 2 is required by the village to install or construct any public improvement of a size or capacity or in a location or with an extension which will benefit adjacent or other properties within the village the president and board of trustees may by ordinance provide for the recapture of part of the cost of such public improvement in accordance with the provisions of this   b the authorization of this section is permissive only the adoption of an ordinance providing for the recapture of part of the cost of any public improvement is discretionary with the president and board of trustees of the village nothing within this within the wheeling municipal obligate the president and board of trustees to provide for recapture or shall entitle any owner or developer of real property to recapture part 2005   application for recapture ordinance and agreement an owner or developer of real property located within the village of wheeling may apply for a recapture agreement and ordinance at any time prior to the installation of the public improvements which are to be the subject of the agreement the application shall be made to the director of community development and shall be accompanied by an application fee as provided in the schedule of fees and charges set forth in of this code and shall include the following in addition to any further requirements which are deemed necessary 1 proof of ownership of the property on which the public improvements are to be constructed or installed together with written authorization by all owners of such real estate duly acknowledged by an officer authorized to administer oaths  2 a description of the public improvements together with such plans and drawings as will enable the village to determine the nature scope and capacity of such improvements  3 an estimate of the cost of construction and installation of the improvements including materials labor design and financing and where applicable a separate identification of those costs and expenses attendant upon the villages request to alter or expand the public improvements to meet village needs or to service areas not owned by the developer or owners  4 a description of the adjacent or other areas within the village of wheeling which will be or which are capable of being serviced or benefited by the proposed public improvements together with a statement or engineering analysis in support of the asserted capability or benefit  5 a legal description of the parcels or areas claimed to be benefited or served by the proposed public improvements together with the identification of the record owners as indicated in the tax record of the appropriate county office of all such property ap 2006 part 2005   procedures for recapturepublic hearing a the president and board of trustees shall hold a public hearing on any proposed recapture ordinance initiated by the corporate authorities or on application by the owner or developer installing or constructing the public improvements the village shall give written notice to the record owner as indicated in the tax records of the appropriate county office of any property expected to be benefited at least fourteen days prior to the passage of any recapture ordinance the village shall also publish notice of the proposed recapture in a secular newspaper of general circulation in the village at least fourteen days prior to the passage of any recapture ordinance all testimonies shall be taken under oath and administered by the village clerk after the public hearing has been conducted the president and board of trustees shall make findings which shall be incorporated into any recapture ordinance to be passed such findings shall include 1 a description of the public improvements for which recapture is to be allowed  2 a specification of the identity of the owners or developer installing such public improvements in whose favor the recapture rights granted by the ordinance shall run  3 a description of the adjacent or other property found by the president and board of trustees to be benefited  4 a limit on the cost of the public improvements for which recapture is to be allowed which shall not exceed the engineers estimate by more than ten percent  5 a formula or specific allocation based on ascertained benefit for distributing an identified portion of the cost of such public improvements to the adjacent or other properties benefited b in addition to the abovementioned findings any recapture ordinance shall contain an express provision that the obligation of the village to reimburse the owner or developer installing or constructing the public improvement shall be a limited obligation payable only out of fees and amounts charged owners of other or adjacent properties found to be benefited if and when the owners of such other or adjacent properties tie into or connect to or use such public improvements c the village manager and village staff are authorized to negotiate with the owners or developers installing or constructing the public improvements and with the owners of adjacent or other properties benefited or asserted to be benefited toward an agreement as to the total cost of the public utilities and as to the proportion of such cost incurred primarily for the benefit of adjacent or other properties any such agreement if approved by the president and board of trustees of the village shall be reflected in the recapture ordinance d after completion of the public improvements for which recapture is to be allowed if the actual cost is less than the limit specified in the recapture ordinance the ordinance shall be amended to reflect such lower amount and the recapture agreement shall be limited to that lower amount if the actual cost is higher than the amount specified in the recapture ordinance no change shall be made in the ordinance and the additional costs shall not be subject to recapture part 2005   recapture ordinance incorporated into agreement a after passage of a recapture ordinance the ordinance shall be incorporated into an agreement between the village and the owner or developer installing the public improvements the agreement may contain such other terms and provisions as deemed appropriate by the village the owner of any adjacent or other property found to be benefited and with whom an agreement has been reached may also become a party to such agreement b the agreement incorporating the recapture ordinance when executed shall be recorded against the property of the owners or developer installing the public improvements and against each of the adjacent or other properties found to be benefited part 2005 street lighting   generally a plan preparation all plans shall be prepared by a authorities shall then direct the plan commission to hold a public meeting as outlined hereafter requests for a variance of this title shall be submitted to the village clerk who shall forward the application to the person designated by the village manager being the village planner or any other person so designated who shall transmit the application to the plan commission for a public hearing thereon with a copy to the board of trustees notice of the time place and subject matter of such public hearing shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the village not more than thirty days nor less than fifteen days prior to the date of such hearing after such hearing the plan commission shall submit its recommendation in a report to the village board of trustees who may then grant or deny the variance requested no variation shall be granted by the village board of trustees unless a public hearing on such variation has been held by the plan commission the plan commission shall recommend to the corporate authorities that any variations from the regulations of this title be granted so long as the variations are legal and in harmony with the general purpose and intent and in accordance with the general or specific rules herein contained only in those areas where there are practical difficulties or particular hardship in conforming to the strict letter of any of the regulations contained in this title part 2005   written notice a in addition to the notice requirements otherwise provided in this an applicant for any public hearing required by this contributes to the comfort convenience or necessity of the party conducting the principal use  and d will not alter the character of the area or be detrimental thereto acreage gross gross acreage illinois and may be so cited and further reference elsewhere as the wheeling zoning  and herein as this  this title or as this  shall imply the same wording and meaning as the full title a part 2005   general purpose and intent this zoning title adopted pursuant to the provisions of inclusive of the illinois municipal passed by the general assembly of the state of illinois and enacted into law on  and as amended from time to time thereafter is intended to serve the following purposes a to promote and protect the public health safety morals comfort convenience and the general welfare of the people  b to implement the provisions of the village of wheelings comprehensive plan  c to protect the character and maintain the stability of residential business commercial and manufacturing areas within the village and to promote the orderly and beneficial development of such areas  d to divide the village into zones and districts restricting and regulating therein the location construction reconstruction alteration and use of buildings structures and land for residential business commercial manufacturing and other specified uses  e to provide adequate light air privacy and convenience of access to property  f to regulate the intensity of use of zoning lots and to determine the area of open spaces surrounding buildings necessary to provide adequate light and air and protect the public health  g to establish building lines and the location of buildings designed for residential business commercial manufacturing or other uses within such lines  h to fix reasonable standards to which buildings or structures shall conform  i to prohibit uses buildings or structures which are incompatible with the character of development or the permitted uses within specified zoning districts  j to prevent such additions to and alterations or remodeling of existing buildings or structures as would not comply with the restrictions and limitations imposed hereunder  k to limit congestion in the public streets and so protect the public health safety convenience and the general welfare by providing for sufficient on or offstreet parking of motor vehicles and for the loading and unloading of commercial vehicles  l to prevent the overcrowding of land and undue concentration of structures so far as is possible and appropriate in each district by regulating the use and the bulk of buildings in relation to the land surrounding them  m to lessen or avoid hazards to persons and damage to property resulting from the accumulation or runoff of stormwater or floodwaters  n to conserve the value of land and buildings throughout the village  o to provide for the gradual elimination of those uses of land buildings and structures and of those buildings and structures which do not conform with the standards of the district in which they are respectively located and are adversely affecting the development and value of property in each district  p and to define and limit the powers and duties of the administration officers and bodies as provided in this title a part 2005   interpretation a minimum requirements in this title the provisions of this title shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety morals and welfare of the village b conflict with other regulations whenever the requirements of this title conflict with the requirements of any other lawfully adopted laws and ordinances the most restrictive or that imposing the higher standards shall govern c cumulative provisions the provisions of this title are cumulative and pose additional limitations upon all other laws and ordinances heretofore passed or which may be passed hereafter governing any subject matter in this title d existing unlawful buildings uses no building structure or use which was not lawfully existing and not deemed to be legally conforming at the time of the adoption of this title shall become or be made lawful solely by reason of the adoption of this title  and to the extent that in any manner the unlawful building structure or use is in conflict with the requirements of this title it remains unlawful e consent not impliedpermits licenses and approvals required nothing contained in this title shall be deemed to be a consent license or permit to use any property or to locate construct or maintain any building structure or facility or to carry on any trade industry occupation or activity without the required permits licenses andor approvals f conflict with covenants this title is not intended to abrogate any easement covenant or any private agreement  provided that where the regulations of this title are more restrictive the requirements of this title shall govern g language 1 words used in this title shall have their customary and ordinary meanings as defined in a standard dictionary except for specific words and phrases as defined in this 2 the present tense includes the past and future tenses easements a part 2005   uses and activities hazardous to aerial navigationprohibited throughout the village notwithstanding any other provisions of this title no use may be made of land or water within the village of wheeling in such a manner as to create electrical or electronic interference with navigational signals or radio or radar communication between the airport and aircraft nor shall any flashing or illuminated advertising or business signs billboards or any other type of illuminated structure be used or installed which would be hazardous for pilots because of the difficulty in distinguishing between airport lights and others or which result in glare in the eyes of pilots using the airport thereby impairing visibility in the vicinity of the airport or endangering the landing taking off or maneuvering of aircraft nor shall any activity occur which would emit or discharge smoke that could be detrimental or injurious to the health safety and general welfare of the public in the use of the airport a part 2005   splitlot zoning where a zoning boundary splits a lot resulting in differing and nonuniform requirements for two or more portions of the lot each portion of the lot and overlay districts mixed use districts general requirements a intent the mx mixed use districts are intended to facilitate the development and redevelopment of areas suited to a combination of commercial and residential uses it is recognized that some mature parts of the village are comprised of a variety of compatible uses and the mixed use districts are created for the purpose of maintaining the vitality of such areas and encouraging appropriate redevelopment as necessary it is also noted that the villages comprehensive plan identifies several areas as appropriate for new mixed use development in the future and these districts are also created to meet that need b site plan review required in the mx mixed use districts site plan review by the plan commission and approval by the board of trustees is required for all new development projects including singlefamily and twofamily homes and any renovations involving alteration in building size changes to the exterior of any building or changes to site elements approved during a prior site plan review all site plan submittals and reviews shall be conducted in accordance with of this title c description of mixed use zoning districts projects proposed in each of the mixed use districts will be reviewed and evaluated according to the objectives of the comprehensive plan and the station area plan the intent of each of the three mixed use districts will guide future development in these areas 1 mxt  transit oriented mixed use district the mxt is the highest density district of the four mixed use districts the comprehensive plan and station area plan envision a town center surrounding the commuter rail station with a mix of retail service and residential uses 2 mxc  commercialresidential mixed use area the mxc is intended to be less dense than the mxt district the comprehensive plan envisions a mix of residential and retail uses either within the same building or in close proximity to each other 3 mxo  open spaceresidential mixed use district the mxo is the lowest density district of the four mixed use districts this district is intended to encourage less intense land use in environmentally sensitive areas the comprehensive plan envisions lower density residential development possibly by clustering mixed with active or passive open space and recreation areas 4 mxi  industrial mixed use the mxi is intended to be similar to the mxc and mxt districts with the exception that certain light industrial uses are also permitted d general use standards 1 all business establishments shall be retail or service establishments dealing directly with consumers except as provided for in the mxi district 2 all operations activities and storage shall be conducted or maintained wholly inside enclosed buildings with the exception of outdoor dining automobile parking offstreet loading areas parking during business hours of trucks and service vehicles owned or operated by the business and storage of landscaping materials for retail sale where any of these activities are allowed in conjunction with an approved use 3 outdoor storage as defined in of this title shall not be permitted 4 all new principal buildings structures and other uses shall be provided with public utilities and served by public streets e parking and circulation for all districts industrial district general requirements a site plan review required in the industrial districts site plan review by the plan commission and approval by the board of trustees is required for all new development projects and any renovations involving alteration in building size changes to the exterior of any building or changes to site elements approved during a prior site plan review all site plan submittals and reviews shall be conducted in accordance with of this title b general use standards 1 no retail sales or services shall be permitted except as accessory to the principal use such accessory retail sales may take place indoors in an area not to exceed ten percent of the gross floor area of the building in which they are situated 2 all operations activities and storage shall be conducted or maintained wholly inside enclosed buildings with the exception of automobile parking offstreet loading areas sale of automobile fuel and lubricants parking of trucks and service vehicles owned or operated by the business where any of these activities are allowed in conjunction with an approved use 3 no basic raw materials shall be converted into any of the following products metals of any kind glass plastics textiles leather or paper 4 no fuel except electricity oil or gas shall be used 5 no part of any building shall be used for residential purposes with the exception that the owner andor custodian of an approved private recreational facility operated for the temporary care and custody of children may reside on the premises 6 all new principal buildings structures and other uses shall be provided with public utilities and served by public streets c parking and circulation 1 bicycle and offstreet parking shall be provided in accordance with the provisions of this title 2 all premises shall be furnished with allweather service walks designed for pedestrian safety and convenience where external sidewalks or bicycle paths exist connections to these shall be provided 3 vehicular access to individual parcels shall be limited and controlled when appropriate existing driveways on the subject property or adjoining properties shall be combined and traffic circulation coordinated curb cuts shall be kept to a minimum d general site development standards 1 landscaping and buffers shall be provided in accordance with the provisions of this title 2 exterior lighting where provided shall be in accordance with the provisions of this title 3 provisions shall be made for storage of refuse in accordance with this title e front yard setback exceptions in the industrial districts the front yard setback requirements of this title shall not apply to any lots where the average existing setback on lots located wholly or in part within one hundred feet on each side of such lot within the same block and zoning district and fronting on the same side of the street as such lot is less than the minimum setback required in such cases setback on such lots may be less than the required setback but not less than the average of the existing setbacks on the aforementioned lots or within ten feet whichever is greater f industrial district design standards 1 see buildings structures and other uses shall be provided with public utilities and served by public streets d permitted uses 1 the following are permitted as principal uses in the ap district a airport and screening f part 2008  a part 2005 b 5162011  c 8202012  g 2172015   runway protection zones and transition areas a intent the purpose of the runway protection zones rpzs and transition areas is to preserve the unique assets that the airport offers to the village and to promote a more comprehensive and consistent land use pattern in the areas adjacent to or in the immediate vicinity of the airport with the rpz and transition area certain requirements are established which apply over and above those set forth under the established zoning district for any affected building structure or use these requirements are intended to regulate the development growth or construction of objects that may become hazards to air traffic utilizing the chicago executive airport and that could endanger the lives and property of users of the airport and of occupants of land in its vicinity by enacting zoning standards safety and airport externalities can be monitored and controlled b runway protection zone and transition area defined the following areas or so much thereof as are within the corporate boundaries of the village hereby described with reference to the runways at the chicago executive airport are designated as the rpz and transition area 1 runway protection zone the dimensions of the rpz depend on the type of runway the following rpz areas are depicted on the zoning map a rpz for a precision instrument runway with respect to runways designated as precision instrument runways the area five hundred feet on either side of the centerline of the runway in width and extending two hundred feet from the end of the runway in both directions in length  plus that area lying directly under the approach surface as defined and established in of title 19a of the wheeling municipal from two hundred feet from the end of the runway to one thousand seven hundred feet out from the end of the runway  and b rpz for a visual runway operational with respect to runways designated as visual runways the area two hundred fifty feet on either side of the centerline of the runway in width and extending two hundred feet from the end of the runway in length  plus that area lying directly under the approach surface as defined and established in of title 19a of the wheeling municipal from two hundred feet outward from the end of the runway to one thousand two hundred twenty feet from the end of the runway 2 transition area the transitional surface as defined in of title 19a of the wheeling municipal is a surface extending outward and upward at right or ninetydegree angles to the runway centerline and the runway centerline extended at a slope of seven feet horizontally for each foot vertically beginning at the sides of and at the same elevation of the primary surface and the approach surfaces extending to a height of one hundred fifty feet above the airport elevation transitional surfaces for those portions of the precision approach surface which project beyond the limits of the conical surface extend a distance of five thousand feet measured horizontally from the edge of the approach surface and at right or ninetydegree angles to the runway centerline c construction in a runway protection zone or transition area 1 within an rpz or transition area no building or structure shall be constructed nor any improvement added to an existing building or structure until such building structure or improvement is determined by the federal aviation administration faa not to be a hazard to aerial navigation 2 no building permit or other license or permit shall be issued for any construction subject to this section until a determination of hazard to air navigation or the equivalent of such determination has been issued by the federal aviation administration covering the proposed construction any permits issued for such construction shall be conditioned upon the construction remaining within the height limits of the plans submitted to the faa and upon compliance with any lighting or marking requirements specified by the faa d limitations of zoning map relative to the airport imaginary surfaces the village planner shall designate the rpz and transition areas on the zoning map of the village and shall cause to be prepared a detailed map showing the areas of the village included in such areas it must be noted that the airport imaginary surfaces defined in title 19a airport zoning of the wheeling municipal are defined by an extent well beyond the perimeter of the rpz and transition area at ground level due consideration shall be given to the review of all development proposals within the village of wheeling relative to the airport imaginary surfaces areas depicted on the zoning map as outside of the rpz and transition area may still require review by the faa with respect to the other airport imaginary surfaces f part 2008 a part 2005 planned unit developments planned unit developments a statement of intent the intent of the planned unit development pud approval process is to promote the maximum benefit from coordinated area site planning by providing opportunities to maximize the economical and efficient use of land in ways that may not be possible under conventional zoning regulations it is intended that planned unit developments established in the village provide a harmonious variety of uses and building types and a high level of amenities in a manner that is consistent with plans for the area as set forth in the village of wheelings comprehensive plan the procedure described in this designed to give the developer initial plan approval before completing all detailed design work while providing the village with assurances that the project will retain the character envisioned at the time of initial approval b planned unit developments vs planned developments a planned unit development is a development which has received approval pud approval process described within this village based 2 mandatory preliminary consultationconcept review and workshop discussion a development review committee prior to review by the village board applicants shall discuss the concept development development review committee any decision of the board of trustees during a workshop discussion is considered nonbinding the board may forward the concept plan to the plan commission request of trustees if the concept plan is to be altered significantly prior to formal submittal of a preliminary pud plan the review process described in this section shall be repeated 3 phased pud approval concept established by the preliminary pud 4 plan commission action a public hearing and plan commission review the plan commission shall hold a public hearing if required as noted in subsection d of application for a preliminary or final pud within ninety days of receiving the report from the plan commission unless the applicant agrees to a time extension failure of the board of trustees to act within the ninetyday period or the agreedupon extended time shall constitute denial of the application once the board of trustees passes the ordinance to approve the final pud the standards and provisions as established in the approved plans shall constitute the zoning regulations for that pud 6 commencement of project after the board of trustees has approved the final pud plans construction areas outside of the subject stage b expiration of approval after the board of trustees has approved the final pud plans the project shall be commenced within one year of the date of the approval ordinance unless the time is extended by ordinance by the board of trustees in the event that construction has not commenced within one year and been actively pursued the approval of the board of trustees shall be deemed to be automatically revoked 7 changes or revisions to an approved planned unit development a submission all proposed changes revisions and additions to any aspect of an
